00164         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);

00178 /*
00179  * the following set of functions are used to maintain per-thread
00180  * cache of FID->ino mapping. this mechanism is needed to resolve
00181  * FID to inode at dt_insert() which in turn stores ino in the
00182  * directory entries to keep ldiskfs compatible with ext[34].
00183  * due to locking-originated restrictions we can't lookup ino
00184  * using LU cache (deadlock is possible). lookup using OI is quite
00185  * expensive. so instead we maintain this cache and methods like
00186  * dt_create() fill it. so in the majority of cases dt_insert() is
00187  * able to find needed mapping in lockless manner.
00188  */
00189 static struct osd_idmap_cache *
00190 osd_idc_find(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00191              const struct lu_fid *fid)
00192 {
00193         struct osd_thread_info  *oti   = osd_oti_get(env);
00194         struct osd_idmap_cache  *idc    = oti->oti_ins_cache;
00195         int i;
00196         for (i = 0; i < oti->oti_ins_cache_used; i++) {
00197                 if (!lu_fid_eq(&idc[i].oic_fid, fid))
00198                         continue;
00199                 if (idc[i].oic_dev != osd)
00200                         continue;
00201 
00202                 return idc + i;
00203         }
00204 
00205         return NULL;
00206 }
00207 
00208 static struct osd_idmap_cache *
00209 osd_idc_add(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00210             const struct lu_fid *fid)
00211 {
00212         struct osd_thread_info  *oti   = osd_oti_get(env);
00213         struct osd_idmap_cache  *idc;
00214         int i;
00215 
00216         if (unlikely(oti->oti_ins_cache_used >= oti->oti_ins_cache_size)) {
00217                 i = oti->oti_ins_cache_size * 2;
00218                 if (i == 0)
00219                         i = OSD_INS_CACHE_SIZE;
00220                 OBD_ALLOC(idc, sizeof(*idc) * i);
00221                 if (idc == NULL)
00222                         return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00223                 if (oti->oti_ins_cache != NULL) {
00224                         memcpy(idc, oti->oti_ins_cache,
00225                                oti->oti_ins_cache_used * sizeof(*idc));
00226                         OBD_FREE(oti->oti_ins_cache,
00227                                  oti->oti_ins_cache_used * sizeof(*idc));
00228                 }
00229                 oti->oti_ins_cache = idc;
00230                 oti->oti_ins_cache_size = i;
00231         }
00232 
00233         idc = oti->oti_ins_cache + oti->oti_ins_cache_used++;
00234         idc->oic_fid = *fid;
00235         idc->oic_dev = osd;
00236         idc->oic_lid.oii_ino = 0;
00237         idc->oic_lid.oii_gen = 0;
00238         idc->oic_remote = 0;
00239 
00240         return idc;
00241 }
00242 
00243 /*
00244  * lookup mapping for the given fid in the cache, initialize a
00245  * new one if not found. the initialization checks whether the
00246  * object is local or remote. for local objects, OI is used to
00247  * learn ino/generation. the function is used when the caller
00248  * has no information about the object, e.g. at dt_insert().
00249  */
00250 static struct osd_idmap_cache *
00251 osd_idc_find_or_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00252                      const struct lu_fid *fid)
00253 {
00254         struct osd_idmap_cache *idc;
00255         int rc;
00256 
00257         idc = osd_idc_find(env, osd, fid);
00258         LASSERT(!IS_ERR(idc));
00259         if (idc != NULL)
00260                 return idc;
00261 
00262         /* new mapping is needed */
00263         idc = osd_idc_add(env, osd, fid);
00264         if (IS_ERR(idc))
00265                 return idc;
00266 
00267         /* initialize it */
00268         rc = osd_remote_fid(env, osd, fid);
00269         if (unlikely(rc < 0))
00270                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00271 
00272         if (rc == 0) {
00273                 /* the object is local, lookup in OI */
00274                 /* XXX: probably cheaper to lookup in LU first? */
00275                 rc = osd_oi_lookup(osd_oti_get(env), osd, fid,
00276                                    &idc->oic_lid, 0);
00277                 if (unlikely(rc < 0)) {
00278                         CERROR("can't lookup: rc = %d\n", rc);
00279                         return ERR_PTR(rc);
00280                 }
00281         } else {
00282                 /* the object is remote */
00283                 idc->oic_remote = 1;
00284         }
00285 
00286         return idc;
00287 }
00288 
00289 /*
00290  * lookup mapping for given FID and fill it from the given object.
00291  * the object is lolcal by definition.
00292  */
00293 static int osd_idc_find_and_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00294                                  struct osd_device *osd,
00295                                  struct osd_object *obj)
00296 {
00297         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00298         struct osd_idmap_cache  *idc;
00299 
00300         idc = osd_idc_find(env, osd, fid);
00301         LASSERT(!IS_ERR(idc));
00302         if (idc != NULL) {
00303                 if (obj->oo_inode == NULL)
00304                         return 0;
00305                 if (idc->oic_lid.oii_ino != obj->oo_inode->i_ino) {
00306                         LASSERT(idc->oic_lid.oii_ino == 0);
00307                         idc->oic_lid.oii_ino = obj->oo_inode->i_ino;
00308                         idc->oic_lid.oii_gen = obj->oo_inode->i_generation;
00309                 }
00310                 return 0;
00311         }
00312 
00313         /* new mapping is needed */
00314         idc = osd_idc_add(env, osd, fid);
00315         if (IS_ERR(idc))
00316                 return PTR_ERR(idc);
00317 
00318         if (obj->oo_inode != NULL) {
00319                 idc->oic_lid.oii_ino = obj->oo_inode->i_ino;
00320                 idc->oic_lid.oii_gen = obj->oo_inode->i_generation;
00321         }
00322         return 0;
00323 }

00329 /*
00330  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that early in object
00331  * life-cycle.
00332  */
00333 static struct lu_object *osd_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00334                                           const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
00335                                           struct lu_device *d)
00336 {
00337         struct osd_object *mo;
00338 
00339         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mo);
00340         if (mo != NULL) {
00341                 struct lu_object *l;
00342 
00343                 l = &mo->oo_dt.do_lu;
00344                 dt_object_init(&mo->oo_dt, NULL, d);
00345                 mo->oo_dt.do_ops = &osd_obj_ea_ops;
00346                 l->lo_ops = &osd_lu_obj_ops;
00347                 init_rwsem(&mo->oo_sem);
00348                 init_rwsem(&mo->oo_ext_idx_sem);
00349                 spin_lock_init(&mo->oo_guard);
00350                 return l;
00351         } else {
00352                 return NULL;
00353         }
00354 }
00355 
00356 int osd_get_lma(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct inode *inode,
00357                 struct dentry *dentry, struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma)
00358 {
00359         int rc;
00360 
00361         CLASSERT(LMA_OLD_SIZE >= sizeof(*lma));
00362         rc = __osd_xattr_get(inode, dentry, XATTR_NAME_LMA,
00363                              info->oti_mdt_attrs_old, LMA_OLD_SIZE);
00364         if (rc > 0) {
00365                 if ((void *)lma != (void *)info->oti_mdt_attrs_old)
00366                         memcpy(lma, info->oti_mdt_attrs_old, sizeof(*lma));
00367                 rc = 0;
00368                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00369                 /* Check LMA compatibility */
00370                 if (lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP) {
00371                         CWARN("%.16s: unsupported incompat LMA feature(s) %#x "
00372                               "for fid = "DFID", ino = %lu\n",
00373                               LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
00374                               lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP,
00375                               PFID(&lma->lma_self_fid), inode->i_ino);
00376                         rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00377                 }
00378         } else if (rc == 0) {
00379                 rc = -ENODATA;
00380         }
00381 
00382         return rc;
00383 }
00384 
00385 /*
00386  * retrieve object from backend ext fs.
00387  **/
00388 struct inode *osd_iget(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00389                        struct osd_inode_id *id)
00390 {
00391         struct inode *inode = NULL;
00392 
00393         /* if we look for an inode withing a running
00394          * transaction, then we risk to deadlock */
00395         /* osd_dirent_check_repair() breaks this */
00396         /*LASSERT(current->journal_info == NULL);*/
00397 
00398         inode = ldiskfs_iget(osd_sb(dev), id->oii_ino);
00399         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00400                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "no inode: ino = %u, rc = %ld\n",
00401                        id->oii_ino, PTR_ERR(inode));
00402         } else if (id->oii_gen != OSD_OII_NOGEN &&
00403                    inode->i_generation != id->oii_gen) {
00404                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "unmatched inode: ino = %u, oii_gen = %u, "
00405                        "i_generation = %u\n",
00406                        id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen, inode->i_generation);
00407                 iput(inode);
00408                 inode = ERR_PTR(-ESTALE);
00409         } else if (inode->i_nlink == 0) {
00410                 /* due to parallel readdir and unlink,
00411                 * we can have dead inode here. */
00412                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "stale inode: ino = %u\n", id->oii_ino);
00413                 iput(inode);
00414                 inode = ERR_PTR(-ESTALE);
00415         } else if (is_bad_inode(inode)) {
00416                 CWARN("%.16s: bad inode: ino = %u\n",
00417                 LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(dev))->s_es->s_volume_name, id->oii_ino);
00418                 iput(inode);
00419                 inode = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00420         } else {
00421                 ldiskfs_clear_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_DESTROY);
00422                 if (id->oii_gen == OSD_OII_NOGEN)
00423                         osd_id_gen(id, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00424 
00425                 /* Do not update file c/mtime in ldiskfs.
00426                  * NB: we don't have any lock to protect this because we don't
00427                  * have reference on osd_object now, but contention with
00428                  * another lookup + attr_set can't happen in the tiny window
00429                  * between if (...) and set S_NOCMTIME. */
00430                 if (!(inode->i_flags & S_NOCMTIME))
00431                         inode->i_flags |= S_NOCMTIME;
00432         }
00433         return inode;
00434 }
00435 
00436 int osd_ldiskfs_add_entry(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00437                           handle_t *handle, struct dentry *child,
00438                           struct inode *inode, struct htree_lock *hlock)
00439 {
00440         int rc, rc2;
00441 
00442         rc = __ldiskfs_add_entry(handle, child, inode, hlock);
00443         if (rc == -ENOBUFS || rc == -ENOSPC) {
00444                 char fidbuf[FID_LEN + 1];
00445                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs lma;
00446                 struct lu_fid fid = { };
00447                 char *errstr;
00448                 struct dentry *p_dentry = child->d_parent;
00449 
00450                 rc2 = osd_get_lma(info, p_dentry->d_inode, p_dentry,
00451                                  &lma);
00452                 if (rc2 == 0) {
00453                         fid = lma.lma_self_fid;
00454                         snprintf(fidbuf, sizeof(fidbuf), DFID, PFID(&fid));
00455                 } else if (rc2 == -ENODATA) {
00456                         if (unlikely(p_dentry->d_inode ==
00457                                      inode->i_sb->s_root->d_inode))
00458                                 lu_local_obj_fid(&fid, OSD_FS_ROOT_OID);
00459                         else if (info->oti_dev && !info->oti_dev->od_is_ost &&
00460                                  fid_seq_is_mdt0(fid_seq(&fid)))
00461                                 lu_igif_build(&fid, p_dentry->d_inode->i_ino,
00462                                               p_dentry->d_inode->i_generation);
00463                         snprintf(fidbuf, sizeof(fidbuf), DFID, PFID(&fid));
00464                 } else {
00465                         snprintf(fidbuf, FID_LEN, "%s", "unknown");
00466                 }
00467 
00468                 if (rc == -ENOSPC)
00469                         errstr = "has reached";
00470                 else
00471                         errstr = "is approaching";
00472                 CWARN("%.16s: directory (inode: %lu FID: %s) %s maximum entry limit\n",
00473                         LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
00474                         p_dentry->d_inode->i_ino, fidbuf, errstr);
00475                 /* ignore such error now */
00476                 if (rc == -ENOBUFS)
00477                         rc = 0;
00478         }
00479         return rc;
00480 }
00481 
00482 
00483 static struct inode *
00484 osd_iget_fid(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00485              struct osd_inode_id *id, struct lu_fid *fid)
00486 {
00487         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma   = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
00488         struct inode            *inode;
00489         int                      rc;
00490 
00491         inode = osd_iget(info, dev, id);
00492         if (IS_ERR(inode))
00493                 return inode;
00494 
00495         rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
00496         if (rc == 0) {
00497                 *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
00498         } else if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00499                 if (unlikely(inode == osd_sb(dev)->s_root->d_inode))
00500                         lu_local_obj_fid(fid, OSD_FS_ROOT_OID);
00501                 else
00502                         lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00503         } else {
00504                 iput(inode);
00505                 inode = ERR_PTR(rc);
00506         }
00507         return inode;
00508 }
00509 
00510 static struct inode *osd_iget_check(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00511                                     struct osd_device *dev,
00512                                     const struct lu_fid *fid,
00513                                     struct osd_inode_id *id,
00514                                     bool cached)
00515 {
00516         struct inode    *inode;
00517         int              rc     = 0;
00518         ENTRY;
00519 
00520         /* The cached OI mapping is trustable. If we cannot locate the inode
00521          * via the cached OI mapping, then return the failure to the caller
00522          * directly without further OI checking. */
00523 
00524         inode = ldiskfs_iget(osd_sb(dev), id->oii_ino);
00525         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00526                 rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00527                 if (cached || (rc != -ENOENT && rc != -ESTALE)) {
00528                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "no inode: ino = %u, rc = %d\n",
00529                                id->oii_ino, rc);
00530 
00531                         GOTO(put, rc);
00532                 }
00533 
00534                 goto check_oi;
00535         }
00536 
00537         if (is_bad_inode(inode)) {
00538                 rc = -ENOENT;
00539                 if (cached) {
00540                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "bad inode: ino = %u\n", id->oii_ino);
00541 
00542                         GOTO(put, rc);
00543                 }
00544 
00545                 goto check_oi;
00546         }
00547 
00548         if (id->oii_gen != OSD_OII_NOGEN &&
00549             inode->i_generation != id->oii_gen) {
00550                 rc = -ESTALE;
00551                 if (cached) {
00552                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "unmatched inode: ino = %u, "
00553                                "oii_gen = %u, i_generation = %u\n",
00554                                id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen, inode->i_generation);
00555 
00556                         GOTO(put, rc);
00557                 }
00558 
00559                 goto check_oi;
00560         }
00561 
00562         if (inode->i_nlink == 0) {
00563                 rc = -ENOENT;
00564                 if (cached) {
00565                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "stale inode: ino = %u\n", id->oii_ino);
00566 
00567                         GOTO(put, rc);
00568                 }
00569 
00570                 goto check_oi;
00571         }
00572 
00573         ldiskfs_clear_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_DESTROY);
00574 
00575 check_oi:
00576         if (rc != 0) {
00577                 LASSERTF(rc == -ESTALE || rc == -ENOENT, "rc = %d\n", rc);
00578 
00579                 rc = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, fid, id, OI_CHECK_FLD);
00580                 /* XXX: There are four possible cases:
00581                  *      1. rc = 0.
00582                  *         Backup/restore caused the OI invalid.
00583                  *      2. rc = 0.
00584                  *         Someone unlinked the object but NOT removed
00585                  *         the OI mapping, such as mount target device
00586                  *         as ldiskfs, and modify something directly.
00587                  *      3. rc = -ENOENT.
00588                  *         Someone just removed the object between the
00589                  *         former oi_lookup and the iget. It is normal.
00590                  *      4. Other failure cases.
00591                  *
00592                  *      Generally, when the device is mounted, it will
00593                  *      auto check whether the system is restored from
00594                  *      file-level backup or not. We trust such detect
00595                  *      to distinguish the 1st case from the 2nd case. */
00596                 if (rc == 0) {
00597                         if (!IS_ERR(inode) && inode->i_generation != 0 &&
00598                             inode->i_generation == id->oii_gen)
00599                                 /* "id->oii_gen != OSD_OII_NOGEN" is for
00600                                  * "@cached == false" case. */
00601                                 rc = -ENOENT;
00602                         else
00603                                 rc = -EREMCHG;
00604                 } else {
00605                         /* If the OI mapping was in OI file before the
00606                          * osd_iget_check(), but now, it is disappear,
00607                          * then it must be removed by race. That is a
00608                          * normal race case. */
00609                 }
00610         } else {
00611                 if (id->oii_gen == OSD_OII_NOGEN)
00612                         osd_id_gen(id, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00613 
00614                 /* Do not update file c/mtime in ldiskfs.
00615                  * NB: we don't have any lock to protect this because we don't
00616                  * have reference on osd_object now, but contention with
00617                  * another lookup + attr_set can't happen in the tiny window
00618                  * between if (...) and set S_NOCMTIME. */
00619                 if (!(inode->i_flags & S_NOCMTIME))
00620                         inode->i_flags |= S_NOCMTIME;
00621         }
00622 
00623         GOTO(put, rc);
00624 
00625 put:
00626         if (rc != 0) {
00627                 if (!IS_ERR(inode))
00628                         iput(inode);
00629 
00630                 inode = ERR_PTR(rc);
00631         }
00632 
00633         return inode;
00634 }
00635 
00641 int osd_get_idif(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct inode *inode,
00642                  struct dentry *dentry, struct lu_fid *fid)
00643 {
00644         struct filter_fid_old   *ff     = &info->oti_ff;
00645         struct ost_id           *ostid  = &info->oti_ostid;
00646         int                      rc;
00647 
00648         rc = __osd_xattr_get(inode, dentry, XATTR_NAME_FID, ff, sizeof(*ff));
00649         if (rc == sizeof(*ff)) {
00650                 rc = 0;
00651                 ostid_set_seq(ostid, le64_to_cpu(ff->ff_seq));
00652                 ostid_set_id(ostid, le64_to_cpu(ff->ff_objid));
00653                 /* XXX: use 0 as the index for compatibility, the caller will
00654                  *      handle index related issues when necessarry. */
00655                 ostid_to_fid(fid, ostid, 0);
00656         } else if (rc == sizeof(struct filter_fid)) {
00657                 rc = 1;
00658         } else if (rc >= 0) {
00659                 rc = -EINVAL;
00660         }
00661 
00662         return rc;
00663 }
00664 
00665 static int osd_lma_self_repair(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00666                                struct osd_device *osd, struct inode *inode,
00667                                const struct lu_fid *fid, __u32 compat)
00668 {
00669         handle_t *jh;
00670         int       rc;
00671 
00672         LASSERT(current->journal_info == NULL);
00673 
00674         jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(osd), LDISKFS_HT_MISC,
00675                                   osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_XATTR_SET]);
00676         if (IS_ERR(jh)) {
00677                 rc = PTR_ERR(jh);
00678                 CWARN("%s: cannot start journal for lma_self_repair: rc = %d\n",
00679                       osd_name(osd), rc);
00680                 return rc;
00681         }
00682 
00683         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid, compat, 0);
00684         if (rc != 0)
00685                 CWARN("%s: cannot self repair the LMA: rc = %d\n",
00686                       osd_name(osd), rc);
00687         ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
00688         return rc;
00689 }
00690 
00691 static int osd_check_lma(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj)
00692 {
00693         struct osd_thread_info  *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
00694         struct osd_device       *osd    = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00695         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma    = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
00696         struct inode            *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
00697         struct dentry           *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
00698         struct lu_fid           *fid    = NULL;
00699         const struct lu_fid     *rfid   = lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00700         int                      rc;
00701         ENTRY;
00702 
00703         CLASSERT(LMA_OLD_SIZE >= sizeof(*lma));
00704         rc = __osd_xattr_get(inode, dentry, XATTR_NAME_LMA,
00705                              info->oti_mdt_attrs_old, LMA_OLD_SIZE);
00706         if (rc == -ENODATA && !fid_is_igif(rfid) && osd->od_check_ff) {
00707                 fid = &lma->lma_self_fid;
00708                 rc = osd_get_idif(info, inode, dentry, fid);
00709                 if ((rc > 0) || (rc == -ENODATA && osd->od_index_in_idif)) {
00710                         /* For the given OST-object, if it has neither LMA nor
00711                          * FID in XATTR_NAME_FID, then the given FID (which is
00712                          * contained in the @obj, from client RPC for locating
00713                          * the OST-object) is trusted. We use it to generate
00714                          * the LMA. */
00715                         osd_lma_self_repair(info, osd, inode, rfid,
00716                                             LMAC_FID_ON_OST);
00717                         RETURN(0);
00718                 }
00719         }
00720 
00721         if (rc < 0)
00722                 RETURN(rc);
00723 
00724         if (rc > 0) {
00725                 rc = 0;
00726                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00727                 if (unlikely((lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP) ||
00728                              CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_LMA_INCOMPAT))) {
00729                         CWARN("%s: unsupported incompat LMA feature(s) %#x for "
00730                               "fid = "DFID", ino = %lu\n", osd_name(osd),
00731                               lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP,
00732                               PFID(rfid), inode->i_ino);
00733                         rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00734                 } else {
00735                         fid = &lma->lma_self_fid;
00736                 }
00737         }
00738 
00739         if (fid != NULL && unlikely(!lu_fid_eq(rfid, fid))) {
00740                 if (fid_is_idif(rfid) && fid_is_idif(fid)) {
00741                         struct ost_id   *oi   = &info->oti_ostid;
00742                         struct lu_fid   *fid1 = &info->oti_fid3;
00743                         __u32            idx  = fid_idif_ost_idx(rfid);
00744 
00745                         /* For old IDIF, the OST index is not part of the IDIF,
00746                          * Means that different OSTs may have the same IDIFs.
00747                          * Under such case, we need to make some compatible
00748                          * check to make sure to trigger OI scrub properly. */
00749                         if (idx != 0 && fid_idif_ost_idx(fid) == 0) {
00750                                 /* Given @rfid is new, LMA is old. */
00751                                 fid_to_ostid(fid, oi);
00752                                 ostid_to_fid(fid1, oi, idx);
00753                                 if (lu_fid_eq(fid1, rfid)) {
00754                                         if (osd->od_index_in_idif)
00755                                                 osd_lma_self_repair(info, osd,
00756                                                         inode, rfid,
00757                                                         LMAC_FID_ON_OST);
00758                                         RETURN(0);
00759                                 }
00760                         }
00761                 }
00762 
00763                 rc = -EREMCHG;
00764         }
00765 
00766         RETURN(rc);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static int osd_fid_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
00770                           const struct lu_fid *fid,
00771                           const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00772 {
00773         struct osd_thread_info *info;
00774         struct lu_device       *ldev   = obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_dev;
00775         struct osd_device      *dev;
00776         struct osd_idmap_cache *oic;
00777         struct osd_inode_id    *id;
00778         struct inode           *inode;
00779         struct osd_scrub       *scrub;
00780         struct scrub_file      *sf;
00781         int                     result;
00782         int                     saved  = 0;
00783         bool                    cached  = true;
00784         bool                    triggered = false;
00785         ENTRY;
00786 
00787         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
00788         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode == NULL);
00789         LASSERTF(fid_is_sane(fid) || fid_is_idif(fid), DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
00790 
00791         dev = osd_dev(ldev);
00792         scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
00793         sf = &scrub->os_file;
00794         info = osd_oti_get(env);
00795         LASSERT(info);
00796         oic = &info->oti_cache;
00797 
00798         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_SRV_ENOENT))
00799                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00800 
00801         /* For the object is created as locking anchor, or for the object to
00802          * be created on disk. No need to osd_oi_lookup() at here because FID
00803          * shouldn't never be re-used, if it's really a duplicate FID from
00804          * unexpected reason, we should be able to detect it later by calling
00805          * do_create->osd_oi_insert(). */
00806         if (conf != NULL && conf->loc_flags & LOC_F_NEW)
00807                 GOTO(out, result = 0);
00808 
00809         /* Search order: 1. per-thread cache. */
00810         if (lu_fid_eq(fid, &oic->oic_fid) &&
00811             likely(oic->oic_dev == dev)) {
00812                 id = &oic->oic_lid;
00813                 goto iget;
00814         }
00815 
00816         id = &info->oti_id;
00817         if (!list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items)) {
00818                 /* Search order: 2. OI scrub pending list. */
00819                 result = osd_oii_lookup(dev, fid, id);
00820                 if (result == 0)
00821                         goto iget;
00822         }
00823 
00824         cached = false;
00825         /* Search order: 3. OI files. */
00826         result = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, fid, id, OI_CHECK_FLD);
00827         if (result == -ENOENT) {
00828                 if (!(fid_is_norm(fid) || fid_is_igif(fid)) ||
00829                     fid_is_on_ost(info, dev, fid, OI_CHECK_FLD) ||
00830                     !ldiskfs_test_bit(osd_oi_fid2idx(dev,fid),
00831                                       sf->sf_oi_bitmap))
00832                         GOTO(out, result = 0);
00833 
00834                 goto trigger;
00835         }
00836 
00837         if (result != 0)
00838                 GOTO(out, result);
00839 
00840 iget:
00841         inode = osd_iget_check(info, dev, fid, id, cached);
00842         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00843                 result = PTR_ERR(inode);
00844                 if (result == -ENOENT || result == -ESTALE)
00845                         GOTO(out, result = -ENOENT);
00846 
00847                 if (result == -EREMCHG) {
00848 
00849 trigger:
00850                         if (unlikely(triggered))
00851                                 GOTO(out, result = saved);
00852 
00853                         triggered = true;
00854                         if (thread_is_running(&scrub->os_thread)) {
00855                                 result = -EINPROGRESS;
00856                         } else if (!dev->od_noscrub) {
00857                                 result = osd_scrub_start(dev, SS_AUTO_FULL |
00858                                         SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN | SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT);
00859                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%.16s: trigger OI scrub by RPC "
00860                                               "for "DFID", rc = %d [1]\n",
00861                                               osd_name(dev), PFID(fid), result);
00862                                 if (result == 0 || result == -EALREADY)
00863                                         result = -EINPROGRESS;
00864                                 else
00865                                         result = -EREMCHG;
00866                         } else {
00867                                 result = -EREMCHG;
00868                         }
00869 
00870                         if (fid_is_on_ost(info, dev, fid, OI_CHECK_FLD))
00871                                 GOTO(out, result);
00872 
00873                         /* We still have chance to get the valid inode: for the
00874                          * object which is referenced by remote name entry, the
00875                          * object on the local MDT will be linked under the dir
00876                          * of "/REMOTE_PARENT_DIR" with its FID string as name.
00877                          *
00878                          * We do not know whether the object for the given FID
00879                          * is referenced by some remote name entry or not, and
00880                          * especially for DNE II, a multiple-linked object may
00881                          * have many name entries reside on many MDTs.
00882                          *
00883                          * To simplify the operation, OSD will not distinguish
00884                          * more, just lookup "/REMOTE_PARENT_DIR". Usually, it
00885                          * only happened for the RPC from other MDT during the
00886                          * OI scrub, or for the client side RPC with FID only,
00887                          * such as FID to path, or from old connected client. */
00888                         saved = result;
00889                         result = osd_lookup_in_remote_parent(info, dev,
00890                                                              fid, id);
00891                         if (result == 0) {
00892                                 cached = true;
00893                                 goto iget;
00894                         }
00895 
00896                         result = saved;
00897                 }
00898 
00899                 GOTO(out, result);
00900         }
00901 
00902         obj->oo_inode = inode;
00903         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode->i_sb == osd_sb(dev));
00904 
00905         result = osd_check_lma(env, obj);
00906         if (result != 0) {
00907                 if (result == -ENODATA) {
00908                         if (cached) {
00909                                 result = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, fid, id,
00910                                                        OI_CHECK_FLD);
00911                                 if (result != 0) {
00912                                         /* result == -ENOENT means that the OI
00913                                          * mapping has been removed by race,
00914                                          * the target inode belongs to other
00915                                          * object.
00916                                          *
00917                                          * Others error also can be returned
00918                                          * directly. */
00919                                         iput(inode);
00920                                         obj->oo_inode = NULL;
00921                                         GOTO(out, result);
00922                                 } else {
00923                                         /* result == 0 means the cached OI
00924                                          * mapping is still in the OI file,
00925                                          * the target the inode is valid. */
00926                                 }
00927                         } else {
00928                                 /* The current OI mapping is from the OI file,
00929                                  * since the inode has been found via
00930                                  * osd_iget_check(), no need recheck OI. */
00931                         }
00932 
00933                         goto found;
00934                 }
00935 
00936                 iput(inode);
00937                 obj->oo_inode = NULL;
00938                 if (result != -EREMCHG)
00939                         GOTO(out, result);
00940 
00941                 if (cached) {
00942                         result = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, fid, id,
00943                                                OI_CHECK_FLD);
00944                         /* result == -ENOENT means the cached OI mapping
00945                          * has been removed from the OI file by race,
00946                          * above target inode belongs to other object.
00947                          *
00948                          * Others error also can be returned directly. */
00949                         if (result != 0)
00950                                 GOTO(out, result);
00951 
00952                         /* result == 0, goto trigger */
00953                 } else {
00954                         /* The current OI mapping is from the OI file,
00955                          * since the inode has been found via
00956                          * osd_iget_check(), no need recheck OI. */
00957                 }
00958 
00959                 goto trigger;
00960         }
00961 
00962 found:
00963         obj->oo_compat_dot_created = 1;
00964         obj->oo_compat_dotdot_created = 1;
00965 
00966         if (!S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode) || !ldiskfs_pdo) /* done */
00967                 GOTO(out, result = 0);
00968 
00969         LASSERT(obj->oo_hl_head == NULL);
00970         obj->oo_hl_head = ldiskfs_htree_lock_head_alloc(HTREE_HBITS_DEF);
00971         if (obj->oo_hl_head == NULL) {
00972                 obj->oo_inode = NULL;
00973                 iput(inode);
00974                 GOTO(out, result = -ENOMEM);
00975         }
00976         GOTO(out, result = 0);
00977 
00978 out:
00979         if (result != 0 && cached)
00980                 fid_zero(&oic->oic_fid);
00981 
00982         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
00983         return result;
00984 }
00985 
00986 /*
00987  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00988  */
00989 static void osd_object_init0(struct osd_object *obj)
00990 {
00991         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode != NULL);
00992         obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops;
00993         obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr |=
00994                 (LOHA_EXISTS | (obj->oo_inode->i_mode & S_IFMT));
00995 }
00996 
00997 /*
00998  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that early in object
00999  * life-cycle.
01000  */
01001 static int osd_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l,
01002                            const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
01003 {
01004         struct osd_object *obj = osd_obj(l);
01005         int result;
01006 
01007         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01008 
01009         if (fid_is_otable_it(&l->lo_header->loh_fid)) {
01010                 obj->oo_dt.do_ops = &osd_obj_otable_it_ops;
01011                 l->lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
01012                 return 0;
01013         }
01014 
01015         result = osd_fid_lookup(env, obj, lu_object_fid(l), conf);
01016         obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops_new;
01017         if (result == 0 && obj->oo_inode != NULL) {
01018                 struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01019                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &oti->oti_mdt_attrs;
01020 
01021                 osd_object_init0(obj);
01022                 result = osd_get_lma(oti, obj->oo_inode,
01023                                      &oti->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
01024                 if (result == 0) {
01025                         /* Convert LMAI flags to lustre LMA flags
01026                          * and cache it to oo_lma_flags */
01027                         obj->oo_lma_flags =
01028                                 lma_to_lustre_flags(lma->lma_incompat);
01029                 } else if (result == -ENODATA) {
01030                         result = 0;
01031                 }
01032         }
01033 
01034         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01035         return result;
01036 }
01037 
01038 /*
01039  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that late in object
01040  * life-cycle.
01041  */
01042 static void osd_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l)
01043 {
01044         struct osd_object *obj = osd_obj(l);
01045 
01046         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01047 
01048         dt_object_fini(&obj->oo_dt);
01049         if (obj->oo_hl_head != NULL)
01050                 ldiskfs_htree_lock_head_free(obj->oo_hl_head);
01051         OBD_FREE_PTR(obj);
01052 }
01053 
01054 /*
01055  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that late in object
01056  * life-cycle.
01057  */
01058 static void osd_index_fini(struct osd_object *o)
01059 {
01060         struct iam_container *bag;
01061 
01062         if (o->oo_dir != NULL) {
01063                 bag = &o->oo_dir->od_container;
01064                 if (o->oo_inode != NULL) {
01065                         if (bag->ic_object == o->oo_inode)
01066                                 iam_container_fini(bag);
01067                 }
01068                 OBD_FREE_PTR(o->oo_dir);
01069                 o->oo_dir = NULL;
01070         }
01071 }
01072 
01073 /*
01074  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that late in object
01075  * life-cycle (for all existing callers, that is. New callers have to provide
01076  * their own locking.)
01077  */
01078 static int osd_inode_unlinked(const struct inode *inode)
01079 {
01080         return inode->i_nlink == 0;
01081 }
01082 
01083 enum {
01084         OSD_TXN_OI_DELETE_CREDITS    = 20,
01085         OSD_TXN_INODE_DELETE_CREDITS = 20
01086 };

01088 /*
01089  * Journal
01090  */
01091 
01092 #if OSD_THANDLE_STATS
01093 
01096 static void osd_th_alloced(struct osd_thandle *oth)
01097 {
01098         oth->oth_alloced = cfs_time_current();
01099 }
01100 
01104 static void osd_th_started(struct osd_thandle *oth)
01105 {
01106         oth->oth_started = cfs_time_current();
01107 }
01108 
01113 static long interval_to_usec(cfs_time_t start, cfs_time_t end)
01114 {
01115         struct timeval val;
01116 
01117         cfs_duration_usec(cfs_time_sub(end, start), &val);
01118         return val.tv_sec * 1000000 + val.tv_usec;
01119 }
01120 
01124 static void __osd_th_check_slow(void *oth, struct osd_device *dev,
01125                                 cfs_time_t alloced, cfs_time_t started,
01126                                 cfs_time_t closed)
01127 {
01128         cfs_time_t now = cfs_time_current();
01129 
01130         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
01131 
01132         lprocfs_counter_add(dev->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_THANDLE_STARTING,
01133                             interval_to_usec(alloced, started));
01134         lprocfs_counter_add(dev->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_THANDLE_OPEN,
01135                             interval_to_usec(started, closed));
01136         lprocfs_counter_add(dev->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_THANDLE_CLOSING,
01137                             interval_to_usec(closed, now));
01138 
01139         if (cfs_time_before(cfs_time_add(alloced, cfs_time_seconds(30)), now)) {
01140                 CWARN("transaction handle %p was open for too long: "
01141                       "now "CFS_TIME_T" ,"
01142                       "alloced "CFS_TIME_T" ,"
01143                       "started "CFS_TIME_T" ,"
01144                       "closed "CFS_TIME_T"\n",
01145                       oth, now, alloced, started, closed);
01146                 libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
01147         }
01148 }
01149 
01150 #define OSD_CHECK_SLOW_TH(oth, dev, expr)                               \
01151 {                                                                       \
01152         cfs_time_t __closed = cfs_time_current();                       \
01153         cfs_time_t __alloced = oth->oth_alloced;                        \
01154         cfs_time_t __started = oth->oth_started;                        \
01155                                                                         \
01156         expr;                                                           \
01157         __osd_th_check_slow(oth, dev, __alloced, __started, __closed);  \
01158 }
01159 
01160 #else /* OSD_THANDLE_STATS */
01161 
01162 #define osd_th_alloced(h)                  do {} while(0)
01163 #define osd_th_started(h)                  do {} while(0)
01164 #define OSD_CHECK_SLOW_TH(oth, dev, expr)  expr
01165 
01166 #endif /* OSD_THANDLE_STATS */
01167 
01168 /*
01169  * Concurrency: doesn't access mutable data.
01170  */
01171 static int osd_param_is_not_sane(const struct osd_device *dev,
01172                                  const struct thandle *th)
01173 {
01174         struct osd_thandle *oh = container_of(th, typeof(*oh), ot_super);
01175 
01176         return oh->ot_credits > osd_transaction_size(dev);
01177 }
01178 
01179 /*
01180  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01181  */
01182 static void osd_trans_commit_cb(struct super_block *sb,
01183                                 struct ldiskfs_journal_cb_entry *jcb, int error)
01184 {
01185         struct osd_thandle *oh = container_of0(jcb, struct osd_thandle, ot_jcb);
01186         struct thandle     *th  = &oh->ot_super;
01187         struct lu_device   *lud = &th->th_dev->dd_lu_dev;
01188         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb, *tmp;
01189 
01190         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
01191 
01192         if (error)
01193                 CERROR("transaction @0x%p commit error: %d\n", th, error);
01194 
01195         dt_txn_hook_commit(th);
01196 
01197         /* call per-transaction callbacks if any */
01198         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oh->ot_commit_dcb_list,
01199                                  dcb_linkage) {
01200                 LASSERTF(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC,
01201                          "commit callback entry: magic=%x name='%s'\n",
01202                          dcb->dcb_magic, dcb->dcb_name);
01203                 list_del_init(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
01204                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, th, dcb, error);
01205         }
01206 
01207         lu_ref_del_at(&lud->ld_reference, &oh->ot_dev_link, "osd-tx", th);
01208         lu_device_put(lud);
01209         th->th_dev = NULL;
01210 
01211         lu_context_exit(&th->th_ctx);
01212         lu_context_fini(&th->th_ctx);
01213         OBD_FREE_PTR(oh);
01214 }
01215 
01216 static struct thandle *osd_trans_create(const struct lu_env *env,
01217                                         struct dt_device *d)
01218 {
01219         struct osd_thread_info  *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01220         struct osd_iobuf        *iobuf = &oti->oti_iobuf;
01221         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01222         struct thandle          *th;
01223         ENTRY;
01224 
01225         /* on pending IO in this thread should left from prev. request */
01226         LASSERT(atomic_read(&iobuf->dr_numreqs) == 0);
01227 
01228         th = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01229         OBD_ALLOC_GFP(oh, sizeof *oh, GFP_NOFS);
01230         if (oh != NULL) {
01231                 oh->ot_quota_trans = &oti->oti_quota_trans;
01232                 memset(oh->ot_quota_trans, 0, sizeof(*oh->ot_quota_trans));
01233                 th = &oh->ot_super;
01234                 th->th_dev = d;
01235                 th->th_result = 0;
01236                 th->th_tags = LCT_TX_HANDLE;
01237                 oh->ot_credits = 0;
01238                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_commit_dcb_list);
01239                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_stop_dcb_list);
01240                 osd_th_alloced(oh);
01241 
01242                 memset(oti->oti_declare_ops, 0,
01243                        sizeof(oti->oti_declare_ops));
01244                 memset(oti->oti_declare_ops_cred, 0,
01245                        sizeof(oti->oti_declare_ops_cred));
01246                 memset(oti->oti_declare_ops_used, 0,
01247                        sizeof(oti->oti_declare_ops_used));
01248         }
01249         RETURN(th);
01250 }
01251 
01252 void osd_trans_dump_creds(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th)
01253 {
01254         struct osd_thread_info  *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01255         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01256 
01257         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01258         LASSERT(oh != NULL);
01259 
01260         CWARN("  create: %u/%u/%u, destroy: %u/%u/%u\n",
01261               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_CREATE],
01262               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_CREATE],
01263               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_CREATE],
01264               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_DESTROY],
01265               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_DESTROY],
01266               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_DESTROY]);
01267         CWARN("  attr_set: %u/%u/%u, xattr_set: %u/%u/%u\n",
01268               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_ATTR_SET],
01269               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_ATTR_SET],
01270               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_ATTR_SET],
01271               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_XATTR_SET],
01272               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_XATTR_SET],
01273               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_XATTR_SET]);
01274         CWARN("  write: %u/%u/%u, punch: %u/%u/%u, quota %u/%u/%u\n",
01275               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_WRITE],
01276               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_WRITE],
01277               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_WRITE],
01278               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_PUNCH],
01279               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_PUNCH],
01280               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_PUNCH],
01281               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_QUOTA],
01282               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_QUOTA],
01283               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_QUOTA]);
01284         CWARN("  insert: %u/%u/%u, delete: %u/%u/%u\n",
01285               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_INSERT],
01286               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_INSERT],
01287               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_INSERT],
01288               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_DELETE],
01289               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_DELETE],
01290               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_DELETE]);
01291         CWARN("  ref_add: %u/%u/%u, ref_del: %u/%u/%u\n",
01292               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_REF_ADD],
01293               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_REF_ADD],
01294               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_REF_ADD],
01295               oti->oti_declare_ops[OSD_OT_REF_DEL],
01296               oti->oti_declare_ops_cred[OSD_OT_REF_DEL],
01297               oti->oti_declare_ops_used[OSD_OT_REF_DEL]);
01298 }
01299 
01300 /*
01301  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01302  */
01303 static int osd_trans_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
01304                            struct thandle *th)
01305 {
01306         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01307         struct osd_device  *dev = osd_dt_dev(d);
01308         handle_t           *jh;
01309         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01310         int rc;
01311 
01312         ENTRY;
01313 
01314         LASSERT(current->journal_info == NULL);
01315 
01316         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01317         LASSERT(oh != NULL);
01318         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
01319 
01320         rc = dt_txn_hook_start(env, d, th);
01321         if (rc != 0)
01322                 GOTO(out, rc);
01323 
01324         if (unlikely(osd_param_is_not_sane(dev, th))) {
01325                 static unsigned long last_printed;
01326                 static int last_credits;
01327 
01328                 /* don't make noise on a tiny testing systems
01329                  * actual credits misuse will be caught anyway */
01330                 if (last_credits != oh->ot_credits &&
01331                     time_after(jiffies, last_printed +
01332                                msecs_to_jiffies(60 * MSEC_PER_SEC)) &&
01333                     osd_transaction_size(dev) > 512) {
01334                         osd_trans_dump_creds(env, th);
01335                         libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
01336                         last_credits = oh->ot_credits;
01337                         last_printed = jiffies;
01338                 }
01339                 /* XXX Limit the credits to 'max_transaction_buffers', and
01340                  *     let the underlying filesystem to catch the error if
01341                  *     we really need so many credits.
01342                  *
01343                  *     This should be removed when we can calculate the
01344                  *     credits precisely. */
01345                 oh->ot_credits = osd_transaction_size(dev);
01346         }
01347 
01348         /*
01349          * XXX temporary stuff. Some abstraction layer should
01350          * be used.
01351          */
01352         jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(dev), LDISKFS_HT_MISC, oh->ot_credits);
01353         osd_th_started(oh);
01354         if (!IS_ERR(jh)) {
01355                 oh->ot_handle = jh;
01356                 LASSERT(oti->oti_txns == 0);
01357                 lu_context_init(&th->th_ctx, th->th_tags);
01358                 lu_context_enter(&th->th_ctx);
01359 
01360                 lu_device_get(&d->dd_lu_dev);
01361                 lu_ref_add_at(&d->dd_lu_dev.ld_reference, &oh->ot_dev_link,
01362                               "osd-tx", th);
01363                 oti->oti_txns++;
01364                 rc = 0;
01365         } else {
01366                 rc = PTR_ERR(jh);
01367         }
01368 out:
01369         RETURN(rc);
01370 }
01371 
01372 static int osd_seq_exists(const struct lu_env *env,
01373                           struct osd_device *osd, u64 seq)
01374 {
01375         struct lu_seq_range     *range = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_seq_range;
01376         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
01377         int                     rc;
01378         ENTRY;
01379 
01380         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
01381         LASSERT(ss->ss_server_fld != NULL);
01382 
01383         rc = osd_fld_lookup(env, osd, seq, range);
01384         if (rc != 0) {
01385                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
01386                         CERROR("%s: can't lookup FLD sequence "LPX64
01387                                ": rc = %d\n", osd_name(osd), seq, rc);
01388                 RETURN(0);
01389         }
01390 
01391         RETURN(ss->ss_node_id == range->lsr_index);
01392 }
01393 
01394 static void osd_trans_stop_cb(struct osd_thandle *oth, int result)
01395 {
01396         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb;
01397         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *tmp;
01398 
01399         /* call per-transaction stop callbacks if any */
01400         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oth->ot_stop_dcb_list,
01401                                  dcb_linkage) {
01402                 LASSERTF(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC,
01403                          "commit callback entry: magic=%x name='%s'\n",
01404                          dcb->dcb_magic, dcb->dcb_name);
01405                 list_del_init(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
01406                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, &oth->ot_super, dcb, result);
01407         }
01408 }
01409 
01410 /*
01411  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01412  */
01413 static int osd_trans_stop(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
01414                           struct thandle *th)
01415 {
01416         int                     rc = 0, remove_agents = 0;
01417         struct osd_thandle     *oh;
01418         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01419         struct osd_iobuf       *iobuf = &oti->oti_iobuf;
01420         struct osd_device      *osd = osd_dt_dev(th->th_dev);
01421         struct qsd_instance    *qsd = osd->od_quota_slave;
01422         struct lquota_trans    *qtrans;
01423         ENTRY;
01424 
01425         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01426 
01427         /* reset OI cache for safety */
01428         oti->oti_ins_cache_used = 0;
01429 
01430         remove_agents = oh->ot_remove_agents;
01431 
01432         qtrans = oh->ot_quota_trans;
01433         oh->ot_quota_trans = NULL;
01434 
01435         if (oh->ot_handle != NULL) {
01436                 handle_t *hdl = oh->ot_handle;
01437 
01438                 /*
01439                  * add commit callback
01440                  * notice we don't do this in osd_trans_start()
01441                  * as underlying transaction can change during truncate
01442                  */
01443                 ldiskfs_journal_callback_add(hdl, osd_trans_commit_cb,
01444                                          &oh->ot_jcb);
01445 
01446                 LASSERT(oti->oti_txns == 1);
01447                 oti->oti_txns--;
01448 
01449                 rc = dt_txn_hook_stop(env, th);
01450                 if (rc != 0)
01451                         CERROR("%s: failed in transaction hook: rc = %d\n",
01452                                osd_name(osd), rc);
01453 
01454                 osd_trans_stop_cb(oh, rc);
01455                 /* hook functions might modify th_sync */
01456                 hdl->h_sync = th->th_sync;
01457 
01458                 oh->ot_handle = NULL;
01459                 OSD_CHECK_SLOW_TH(oh, osd, rc = ldiskfs_journal_stop(hdl));
01460                 if (rc != 0)
01461                         CERROR("%s: failed to stop transaction: rc = %d\n",
01462                                osd_name(osd), rc);
01463         } else {
01464                 osd_trans_stop_cb(oh, th->th_result);
01465                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oh);
01466         }
01467 
01468         /* inform the quota slave device that the transaction is stopping */
01469         qsd_op_end(env, qsd, qtrans);
01470 
01471         /* as we want IO to journal and data IO be concurrent, we don't block
01472          * awaiting data IO completion in osd_do_bio(), instead we wait here
01473          * once transaction is submitted to the journal. all reqular requests
01474          * don't do direct IO (except read/write), thus this wait_event becomes
01475          * no-op for them.
01476          *
01477          * IMPORTANT: we have to wait till any IO submited by the thread is
01478          * completed otherwise iobuf may be corrupted by different request
01479          */
01480         wait_event(iobuf->dr_wait,
01481                        atomic_read(&iobuf->dr_numreqs) == 0);
01482         osd_fini_iobuf(osd, iobuf);
01483         if (!rc)
01484                 rc = iobuf->dr_error;
01485 
01486         if (unlikely(remove_agents != 0))
01487                 osd_process_scheduled_agent_removals(env, osd);
01488 
01489         RETURN(rc);
01490 }
01491 
01492 static int osd_trans_cb_add(struct thandle *th, struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb)
01493 {
01494         struct osd_thandle *oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle,
01495                                                ot_super);
01496 
01497         LASSERT(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC);
01498         LASSERT(&dcb->dcb_func != NULL);
01499         if (dcb->dcb_flags & DCB_TRANS_STOP)
01500                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oh->ot_stop_dcb_list);
01501         else
01502                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oh->ot_commit_dcb_list);
01503 
01504         return 0;
01505 }
01506 
01507 /*
01508  * Called just before object is freed. Releases all resources except for
01509  * object itself (that is released by osd_object_free()).
01510  *
01511  * Concurrency: no concurrent access is possible that late in object
01512  * life-cycle.
01513  */
01514 static void osd_object_delete(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *l)
01515 {
01516         struct osd_object *obj   = osd_obj(l);
01517         struct inode      *inode = obj->oo_inode;
01518 
01519         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01520 
01521         /*
01522          * If object is unlinked remove fid->ino mapping from object index.
01523          */
01524 
01525         osd_index_fini(obj);
01526         if (inode != NULL) {
01527                 struct qsd_instance     *qsd = osd_obj2dev(obj)->od_quota_slave;
01528                 qid_t                    uid = i_uid_read(inode);
01529                 qid_t                    gid = i_gid_read(inode);
01530 
01531                 iput(inode);
01532                 obj->oo_inode = NULL;
01533 
01534                 if (qsd != NULL) {
01535                         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
01536                         struct lquota_id_info   *qi = &info->oti_qi;
01537 
01538                         /* Release granted quota to master if necessary */
01539                         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = uid;
01540                         qsd_op_adjust(env, qsd, &qi->lqi_id, USRQUOTA);
01541 
01542                         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = gid;
01543                         qsd_op_adjust(env, qsd, &qi->lqi_id, GRPQUOTA);
01544                 }
01545         }
01546 }
01547 
01548 /*
01549  * Concurrency: ->loo_object_release() is called under site spin-lock.
01550  */
01551 static void osd_object_release(const struct lu_env *env,
01552                                struct lu_object *l)
01553 {
01554         struct osd_object *o = osd_obj(l);
01555         /* nobody should be releasing a non-destroyed object with nlink=0
01556          * the API allows this, but ldiskfs doesn't like and then report
01557          * this inode as deleted */
01558         if (unlikely(!o->oo_destroyed && o->oo_inode && o->oo_inode->i_nlink == 0))
01559                 LBUG();
01560 }
01561 
01562 /*
01563  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01564  */
01565 static int osd_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
01566                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *l)
01567 {
01568         struct osd_object *o = osd_obj(l);
01569         struct iam_descr  *d;
01570 
01571         if (o->oo_dir != NULL)
01572                 d = o->oo_dir->od_container.ic_descr;
01573         else
01574                 d = NULL;
01575         return (*p)(env, cookie,
01576                     LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME"-object@%p(i:%p:%lu/%u)[%s]",
01577                     o, o->oo_inode,
01578                     o->oo_inode ? o->oo_inode->i_ino : 0UL,
01579                     o->oo_inode ? o->oo_inode->i_generation : 0,
01580                     d ? d->id_ops->id_name : "plain");
01581 }
01582 
01583 /*
01584  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01585  */
01586 int osd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
01587                struct obd_statfs *sfs)
01588 {
01589         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dt_dev(d);
01590         struct super_block      *sb = osd_sb(osd);
01591         struct kstatfs          *ksfs;
01592         __u64                    reserved;
01593         int                      result = 0;
01594 
01595         if (unlikely(osd->od_mnt == NULL))
01596                 return -EINPROGRESS;
01597 
01598         /* osd_lproc.c call this without env, allocate ksfs for that case */
01599         if (unlikely(env == NULL)) {
01600                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ksfs);
01601                 if (ksfs == NULL)
01602                         return -ENOMEM;
01603         } else {
01604                 ksfs = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_ksfs;
01605         }
01606 
01607         result = sb->s_op->statfs(sb->s_root, ksfs);
01608         if (result)
01609                 goto out;
01610 
01611         statfs_pack(sfs, ksfs);
01612         if (unlikely(sb->s_flags & MS_RDONLY))
01613                 sfs->os_state = OS_STATE_READONLY;
01614         if (LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(sb,
01615                                          LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_EXTENTS))
01616                 sfs->os_maxbytes = sb->s_maxbytes;
01617         else
01618                 sfs->os_maxbytes = LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_bitmap_maxbytes;
01619 
01620         /*
01621          * Reserve some space so to avoid fragmenting the filesystem too much.
01622          * Fragmentation not only impacts performance, but can also increase
01623          * metadata overhead significantly, causing grant calculation to be
01624          * wrong.
01625          *
01626          * Reserve 0.78% of total space, at least 8MB for small filesystems.
01627          */
01628         CLASSERT(OSD_STATFS_RESERVED > LDISKFS_MAX_BLOCK_SIZE);
01629         reserved = OSD_STATFS_RESERVED >> sb->s_blocksize_bits;
01630         if (likely(sfs->os_blocks >= reserved << OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SHIFT))
01631                 reserved = sfs->os_blocks >> OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SHIFT;
01632 
01633         sfs->os_blocks -= reserved;
01634         sfs->os_bfree  -= min(reserved, sfs->os_bfree);
01635         sfs->os_bavail -= min(reserved, sfs->os_bavail);
01636 
01637 out:
01638         if (unlikely(env == NULL))
01639                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ksfs);
01640         return result;
01641 }
01642 
01648 #ifdef __LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN
01649 #define PER_OBJ_USAGE __LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(20)
01650 #else
01651 #define PER_OBJ_USAGE LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(20)
01652 #endif
01653 
01654 /*
01655  * Concurrency: doesn't access mutable data.
01656  */
01657 static void osd_conf_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01658                          const struct dt_device *dev,
01659                          struct dt_device_param *param)
01660 {
01661         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd_dt_dev(dev));
01662         int                ea_overhead;
01663 
01664         /*
01665          * XXX should be taken from not-yet-existing fs abstraction layer.
01666          */
01667         param->ddp_max_name_len = LDISKFS_NAME_LEN;
01668         param->ddp_max_nlink    = LDISKFS_LINK_MAX;
01669         param->ddp_symlink_max  = sb->s_blocksize;
01670         param->ddp_mount_type     = LDD_MT_LDISKFS;
01671         if (LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(sb, LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_EXTENTS))
01672                 param->ddp_maxbytes = sb->s_maxbytes;
01673         else
01674                 param->ddp_maxbytes = LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_bitmap_maxbytes;
01675         /* inode are statically allocated, so per-inode space consumption
01676          * is the space consumed by the directory entry */
01677         param->ddp_inodespace     = PER_OBJ_USAGE;
01678         /* EXT_INIT_MAX_LEN is the theoretical maximum extent size  (32k blocks
01679          * = 128MB) which is unlikely to be hit in real life. Report a smaller
01680          * maximum length to not under count the actual number of extents
01681          * needed for writing a file. */
01682         param->ddp_max_extent_blks = EXT_INIT_MAX_LEN >> 2;
01683         /* worst-case extent insertion metadata overhead */
01684         param->ddp_extent_tax = 6 * LDISKFS_BLOCK_SIZE(sb);
01685         param->ddp_mntopts      = 0;
01686         if (test_opt(sb, XATTR_USER))
01687                 param->ddp_mntopts |= MNTOPT_USERXATTR;
01688         if (test_opt(sb, POSIX_ACL))
01689                 param->ddp_mntopts |= MNTOPT_ACL;
01690 
01691         /* LOD might calculate the max stripe count based on max_ea_size,
01692          * so we need take account in the overhead as well,
01693          * xattr_header + magic + xattr_entry_head */
01694         ea_overhead = sizeof(struct ldiskfs_xattr_header) + sizeof(__u32) +
01695                       LDISKFS_XATTR_LEN(XATTR_NAME_MAX_LEN);
01696 
01697 #if defined(LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_EA_INODE)
01698         if (LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(sb, LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_EA_INODE))
01699                 param->ddp_max_ea_size = LDISKFS_XATTR_MAX_LARGE_EA_SIZE -
01700                                                                 ea_overhead;
01701         else
01702 #endif
01703                 param->ddp_max_ea_size = sb->s_blocksize - ea_overhead;
01704 }
01705 
01706 /*
01707  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01708  */
01709 static int osd_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d)
01710 {
01711         int rc;
01712 
01713         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "syncing OSD %s\n", LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME);
01714 
01715         rc = ldiskfs_force_commit(osd_sb(osd_dt_dev(d)));
01716 
01717         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "synced OSD %s: rc = %d\n",
01718                LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME, rc);
01719 
01720         return rc;
01721 }
01722 
01735 static int osd_commit_async(const struct lu_env *env,
01736                             struct dt_device *d)
01737 {
01738         struct super_block *s = osd_sb(osd_dt_dev(d));
01739         ENTRY;
01740 
01741         CDEBUG(D_HA, "async commit OSD %s\n", LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME);
01742         RETURN(s->s_op->sync_fs(s, 0));
01743 }
01744 
01745 /*
01746  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
01747  */
01748 
01749 static int osd_ro(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d)
01750 {
01751         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd_dt_dev(d));
01752         struct block_device *dev = sb->s_bdev;
01753 #ifdef HAVE_DEV_SET_RDONLY
01754         struct block_device *jdev = LDISKFS_SB(sb)->journal_bdev;
01755         int rc = 0;
01756 #else
01757         int rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
01758 #endif
01759         ENTRY;
01760 
01761 #ifdef HAVE_DEV_SET_RDONLY
01762         CERROR("*** setting %s read-only ***\n", osd_dt_dev(d)->od_svname);
01763 
01764         if (jdev && (jdev != dev)) {
01765                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL | D_HA, "set journal dev %lx rdonly\n",
01766                        (long)jdev);
01767                 dev_set_rdonly(jdev);
01768         }
01769         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL | D_HA, "set dev %lx rdonly\n", (long)dev);
01770         dev_set_rdonly(dev);
01771 #else
01772         CERROR("%s: %lx CANNOT BE SET READONLY: rc = %d\n",
01773                osd_dt_dev(d)->od_svname, (long)dev, rc);
01774 #endif
01775         RETURN(rc);
01776 }
01777 
01782 const int osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_NR] = {
01790         [DTO_INDEX_INSERT]  = 16,
01795         [DTO_INDEX_DELETE]  = 1,
01799         [DTO_INDEX_UPDATE]  = 16,
01804         [DTO_OBJECT_CREATE] = 4,
01809         [DTO_OBJECT_DELETE] = 4,
01813         [DTO_ATTR_SET_BASE] = 1,
01820         [DTO_XATTR_SET]     = 14,
01824         [DTO_WRITE_BASE]    = 3,
01828         [DTO_WRITE_BLOCK]   = 14,
01833         [DTO_ATTR_SET_CHOWN] = 0
01834 };
01835 
01836 static const struct dt_device_operations osd_dt_ops = {
01837         .dt_root_get       = osd_root_get,
01838         .dt_statfs         = osd_statfs,
01839         .dt_trans_create   = osd_trans_create,
01840         .dt_trans_start    = osd_trans_start,
01841         .dt_trans_stop     = osd_trans_stop,
01842         .dt_trans_cb_add   = osd_trans_cb_add,
01843         .dt_conf_get       = osd_conf_get,
01844         .dt_sync           = osd_sync,
01845         .dt_ro             = osd_ro,
01846         .dt_commit_async   = osd_commit_async,
01847 };
01848 
01849 static void osd_object_read_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
01850                                  struct dt_object *dt, unsigned role)
01851 {
01852         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01853         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01854 
01855         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01856 
01857         LASSERT(obj->oo_owner != env);
01858         down_read_nested(&obj->oo_sem, role);
01859 
01860         LASSERT(obj->oo_owner == NULL);
01861         oti->oti_r_locks++;
01862 }
01863 
01864 static void osd_object_write_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
01865                                   struct dt_object *dt, unsigned role)
01866 {
01867         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01868         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01869 
01870         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01871 
01872         LASSERT(obj->oo_owner != env);
01873         down_write_nested(&obj->oo_sem, role);
01874 
01875         LASSERT(obj->oo_owner == NULL);
01876         obj->oo_owner = env;
01877         oti->oti_w_locks++;
01878 }
01879 
01880 static void osd_object_read_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
01881                                    struct dt_object *dt)
01882 {
01883         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01884         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01885 
01886         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01887 
01888         LASSERT(oti->oti_r_locks > 0);
01889         oti->oti_r_locks--;
01890         up_read(&obj->oo_sem);
01891 }
01892 
01893 static void osd_object_write_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
01894                                     struct dt_object *dt)
01895 {
01896         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01897         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01898 
01899         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01900 
01901         LASSERT(obj->oo_owner == env);
01902         LASSERT(oti->oti_w_locks > 0);
01903         oti->oti_w_locks--;
01904         obj->oo_owner = NULL;
01905         up_write(&obj->oo_sem);
01906 }
01907 
01908 static int osd_object_write_locked(const struct lu_env *env,
01909                                    struct dt_object *dt)
01910 {
01911         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01912 
01913         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01914 
01915         return obj->oo_owner == env;
01916 }
01917 
01918 static struct timespec *osd_inode_time(const struct lu_env *env,
01919                                        struct inode *inode, __u64 seconds)
01920 {
01921         struct osd_thread_info  *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01922         struct timespec         *t   = &oti->oti_time;
01923 
01924         t->tv_sec = seconds;
01925         t->tv_nsec = 0;
01926         *t = timespec_trunc(*t, inode->i_sb->s_time_gran);
01927         return t;
01928 }
01929 
01930 static void osd_inode_getattr(const struct lu_env *env,
01931                               struct inode *inode, struct lu_attr *attr)
01932 {
01933         attr->la_valid  |= LA_ATIME | LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME | LA_MODE |
01934                            LA_SIZE | LA_BLOCKS | LA_UID | LA_GID |
01935                            LA_FLAGS | LA_NLINK | LA_RDEV | LA_BLKSIZE |
01936                            LA_TYPE;
01937 
01938         attr->la_atime   = LTIME_S(inode->i_atime);
01939         attr->la_mtime   = LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime);
01940         attr->la_ctime   = LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime);
01941         attr->la_mode    = inode->i_mode;
01942         attr->la_size    = i_size_read(inode);
01943         attr->la_blocks  = inode->i_blocks;
01944         attr->la_uid     = i_uid_read(inode);
01945         attr->la_gid     = i_gid_read(inode);
01946         attr->la_flags   = ll_inode_to_ext_flags(inode->i_flags);
01947         attr->la_nlink   = inode->i_nlink;
01948         attr->la_rdev    = inode->i_rdev;
01949         attr->la_blksize = 1 << inode->i_blkbits;
01950         attr->la_blkbits = inode->i_blkbits;
01951 }
01952 
01953 static int osd_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01954                         struct dt_object *dt,
01955                         struct lu_attr *attr)
01956 {
01957         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01958 
01959         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(dt)))
01960                 return -ENOENT;
01961         if (unlikely(obj->oo_destroyed))
01962                 return -ENOENT;
01963 
01964         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
01965         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
01966 
01967         spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
01968         osd_inode_getattr(env, obj->oo_inode, attr);
01969         if (obj->oo_lma_flags & LUSTRE_ORPHAN_FL)
01970                 attr->la_flags |= LUSTRE_ORPHAN_FL;
01971         spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
01972 
01973         return 0;
01974 }
01975 
01976 static int osd_declare_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
01977                                 struct dt_object *dt,
01978                                 const struct lu_attr *attr,
01979                                 struct thandle *handle)
01980 {
01981         struct osd_thandle     *oh;
01982         struct osd_object      *obj;
01983         struct osd_thread_info *info = osd_oti_get(env);
01984         struct lquota_id_info  *qi = &info->oti_qi;
01985         qid_t                   uid;
01986         qid_t                   gid;
01987         long long               bspace;
01988         int                     rc = 0;
01989         bool                    enforce;
01990         ENTRY;
01991 
01992         LASSERT(dt != NULL);
01993         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01994 
01995         obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01996         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01997 
01998         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01999         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
02000 
02001         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_ATTR_SET,
02002                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_ATTR_SET_BASE]);
02003 
02004         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET,
02005                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_XATTR_SET]);
02006 
02007         if (attr == NULL || obj->oo_inode == NULL)
02008                 RETURN(rc);
02009 
02010         bspace   = obj->oo_inode->i_blocks;
02011         bspace <<= obj->oo_inode->i_sb->s_blocksize_bits;
02012         bspace   = toqb(bspace);
02013 
02014         /* Changing ownership is always preformed by super user, it should not
02015          * fail with EDQUOT.
02016          *
02017          * We still need to call the osd_declare_qid() to calculate the journal
02018          * credits for updating quota accounting files and to trigger quota
02019          * space adjustment once the operation is completed.*/
02020         if (attr->la_valid & LA_UID || attr->la_valid & LA_GID) {
02021                 /* USERQUOTA */
02022                 uid = i_uid_read(obj->oo_inode);
02023                 qi->lqi_type = USRQUOTA;
02024                 enforce = (attr->la_valid & LA_UID) && (attr->la_uid != uid);
02025                 /* inode accounting */
02026                 qi->lqi_is_blk = false;
02027 
02028                 /* one more inode for the new uid ... */
02029                 qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = attr->la_uid;
02030                 qi->lqi_space      = 1;
02031                 /* Reserve credits for the new uid */
02032                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, NULL, enforce, NULL);
02033                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02034                         rc = 0;
02035                 if (rc)
02036                         RETURN(rc);
02037 
02038                 /* and one less inode for the current uid */
02039                 qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = uid;
02040                 qi->lqi_space      = -1;
02041                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
02042                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02043                         rc = 0;
02044                 if (rc)
02045                         RETURN(rc);
02046 
02047                 /* block accounting */
02048                 qi->lqi_is_blk = true;
02049 
02050                 /* more blocks for the new uid ... */
02051                 qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = attr->la_uid;
02052                 qi->lqi_space      = bspace;
02053                 /*
02054                  * Credits for the new uid has been reserved, re-use "obj"
02055                  * to save credit reservation.
02056                  */
02057                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
02058                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02059                         rc = 0;
02060                 if (rc)
02061                         RETURN(rc);
02062 
02063                 /* and finally less blocks for the current uid */
02064                 qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = uid;
02065                 qi->lqi_space      = -bspace;
02066                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
02067                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02068                         rc = 0;
02069                 if (rc)
02070                         RETURN(rc);
02071 
02072                 /* GROUP QUOTA */
02073                 gid = i_gid_read(obj->oo_inode);
02074                 qi->lqi_type = GRPQUOTA;
02075                 enforce = (attr->la_valid & LA_GID) && (attr->la_gid != gid);
02076 
02077                 /* inode accounting */
02078                 qi->lqi_is_blk = false;
02079 
02080                 /* one more inode for the new gid ... */
02081                 qi->lqi_id.qid_gid = attr->la_gid;
02082                 qi->lqi_space      = 1;
02083                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, NULL, enforce, NULL);
02084                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02085                         rc = 0;
02086                 if (rc)
02087                         RETURN(rc);
02088 
02089                 /* and one less inode for the current gid */
02090                 qi->lqi_id.qid_gid = gid;
02091                 qi->lqi_space      = -1;
02092                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
02093                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02094                         rc = 0;
02095                 if (rc)
02096                         RETURN(rc);
02097 
02098                 /* block accounting */
02099                 qi->lqi_is_blk = true;
02100 
02101                 /* more blocks for the new gid ... */
02102                 qi->lqi_id.qid_gid = attr->la_gid;
02103                 qi->lqi_space      = bspace;
02104                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
