02105                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02106                         rc = 0;
02107                 if (rc)
02108                         RETURN(rc);
02109 
02110                 /* and finally less blocks for the current gid */
02111                 qi->lqi_id.qid_gid = gid;
02112                 qi->lqi_space      = -bspace;
02113                 rc = osd_declare_qid(env, oh, qi, obj, enforce, NULL);
02114                 if (rc == -EDQUOT || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
02115                         rc = 0;
02116                 if (rc)
02117                         RETURN(rc);
02118         }
02119 
02120         RETURN(rc);
02121 }
02122 
02123 static int osd_inode_setattr(const struct lu_env *env,
02124                              struct inode *inode, const struct lu_attr *attr)
02125 {
02126         __u64 bits = attr->la_valid;
02127 
02128         /* Only allow set size for regular file */
02129         if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode))
02130                 bits &= ~(LA_SIZE | LA_BLOCKS);
02131 
02132         if (bits == 0)
02133                 return 0;
02134 
02135         if (bits & LA_ATIME)
02136                 inode->i_atime  = *osd_inode_time(env, inode, attr->la_atime);
02137         if (bits & LA_CTIME)
02138                 inode->i_ctime  = *osd_inode_time(env, inode, attr->la_ctime);
02139         if (bits & LA_MTIME)
02140                 inode->i_mtime  = *osd_inode_time(env, inode, attr->la_mtime);
02141         if (bits & LA_SIZE) {
02142                 LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_disksize = attr->la_size;
02143                 i_size_write(inode, attr->la_size);
02144         }
02145 
02146 #if 0
02147         /* OSD should not change "i_blocks" which is used by quota.
02148          * "i_blocks" should be changed by ldiskfs only. */
02149         if (bits & LA_BLOCKS)
02150                 inode->i_blocks = attr->la_blocks;
02151 #endif
02152         if (bits & LA_MODE)
02153                 inode->i_mode = (inode->i_mode & S_IFMT) |
02154                                 (attr->la_mode & ~S_IFMT);
02155         if (bits & LA_UID)
02156                 i_uid_write(inode, attr->la_uid);
02157         if (bits & LA_GID)
02158                 i_gid_write(inode, attr->la_gid);
02159         if (bits & LA_NLINK)
02160                 set_nlink(inode, attr->la_nlink);
02161         if (bits & LA_RDEV)
02162                 inode->i_rdev = attr->la_rdev;
02163 
02164         if (bits & LA_FLAGS) {
02165                 /* always keep S_NOCMTIME */
02166                 inode->i_flags = ll_ext_to_inode_flags(attr->la_flags) |
02167                                  S_NOCMTIME;
02168         }
02169         return 0;
02170 }
02171 
02172 static int osd_quota_transfer(struct inode *inode, const struct lu_attr *attr)
02173 {
02174         if ((attr->la_valid & LA_UID && attr->la_uid != i_uid_read(inode)) ||
02175             (attr->la_valid & LA_GID && attr->la_gid != i_gid_read(inode))) {
02176                 struct iattr    iattr;
02177                 int             rc;
02178 
02179                 ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
02180                 iattr.ia_valid = 0;
02181                 if (attr->la_valid & LA_UID)
02182                         iattr.ia_valid |= ATTR_UID;
02183                 if (attr->la_valid & LA_GID)
02184                         iattr.ia_valid |= ATTR_GID;
02185                 iattr.ia_uid = make_kuid(&init_user_ns, attr->la_uid);
02186                 iattr.ia_gid = make_kgid(&init_user_ns, attr->la_gid);
02187 
02188                 rc = ll_vfs_dq_transfer(inode, &iattr);
02189                 if (rc) {
02190                         CERROR("%s: quota transfer failed: rc = %d. Is quota "
02191                                "enforcement enabled on the ldiskfs "
02192                                "filesystem?\n", inode->i_sb->s_id, rc);
02193                         return rc;
02194                 }
02195         }
02196         return 0;
02197 }
02198 
02199 static int osd_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
02200                         struct dt_object *dt,
02201                         const struct lu_attr *attr,
02202                         struct thandle *handle)
02203 {
02204         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
02205         struct inode      *inode;
02206         int rc;
02207 
02208         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
02209                 return -ENOENT;
02210 
02211         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
02212         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
02213         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
02214 
02215         osd_trans_exec_op(env, handle, OSD_OT_ATTR_SET);
02216 
02217         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_FID_MAPPING)) {
02218                 struct osd_thread_info  *oti  = osd_oti_get(env);
02219                 const struct lu_fid     *fid0 = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
02220                 struct lu_fid           *fid1 = &oti->oti_fid;
02221                 struct osd_inode_id     *id   = &oti->oti_id;
02222                 struct iam_path_descr   *ipd;
02223                 struct iam_container    *bag;
02224                 struct osd_thandle      *oh;
02225                 int                      rc;
02226 
02227                 fid_cpu_to_be(fid1, fid0);
02228                 memset(id, 1, sizeof(*id));
02229                 bag = &osd_fid2oi(osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev),
02230                                   fid0)->oi_dir.od_container;
02231                 ipd = osd_idx_ipd_get(env, bag);
02232                 if (unlikely(ipd == NULL))
02233                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02234 
02235                 oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02236                 rc = iam_update(oh->ot_handle, bag, (const struct iam_key *)fid1,
02237                                 (const struct iam_rec *)id, ipd);
02238                 osd_ipd_put(env, bag, ipd);
02239                 return(rc > 0 ? 0 : rc);
02240         }
02241 
02242         inode = obj->oo_inode;
02243 
02244         rc = osd_quota_transfer(inode, attr);
02245         if (rc)
02246                 return rc;
02247 
02248         spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
02249         rc = osd_inode_setattr(env, inode, attr);
02250         spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
02251         if (rc != 0)
02252                 GOTO(out, rc);
02253 
02254         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
02255 
02256         if (!(attr->la_valid & LA_FLAGS))
02257                 GOTO(out, rc);
02258 
02259         /* Let's check if there are extra flags need to be set into LMA */
02260         if (attr->la_flags & LUSTRE_LMA_FL_MASKS) {
02261                 struct osd_thread_info *info = osd_oti_get(env);
02262                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
02263 
02264                 rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
02265                 if (rc != 0)
02266                         GOTO(out, rc);
02267 
02268                 lma->lma_incompat |=
02269                         lustre_to_lma_flags(attr->la_flags);
02270                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
02271                 rc = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA,
02272                                      lma, sizeof(*lma), XATTR_REPLACE);
02273                 if (rc != 0) {
02274                         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
02275 
02276                         CWARN("%s: set "DFID" lma flags %u failed: rc = %d\n",
02277                               osd_name(osd), PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)),
02278                               lma->lma_incompat, rc);
02279                 } else {
02280                         obj->oo_lma_flags =
02281                                 attr->la_flags & LUSTRE_LMA_FL_MASKS;
02282                 }
02283                 osd_trans_exec_check(env, handle, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET);
02284         }
02285 out:
02286         osd_trans_exec_check(env, handle, OSD_OT_ATTR_SET);
02287 
02288         return rc;
02289 }
02290 
02291 static struct dentry *osd_child_dentry_get(const struct lu_env *env,
02292                                            struct osd_object *obj,
02293                                            const char *name, const int namelen)
02294 {
02295         return osd_child_dentry_by_inode(env, obj->oo_inode, name, namelen);
02296 }
02297 
02298 static int osd_mkfile(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02299                       umode_t mode, struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02300                       struct thandle *th)
02301 {
02302         int result;
02303         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
02304         struct osd_thandle *oth;
02305         struct dt_object   *parent = NULL;
02306         struct inode       *inode;
02307 
02308         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
02309         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode == NULL);
02310         LASSERT(obj->oo_hl_head == NULL);
02311 
02312         if (S_ISDIR(mode) && ldiskfs_pdo) {
02313                 obj->oo_hl_head =ldiskfs_htree_lock_head_alloc(HTREE_HBITS_DEF);
02314                 if (obj->oo_hl_head == NULL)
02315                         return -ENOMEM;
02316         }
02317 
02318         oth = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02319         LASSERT(oth->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
02320 
02321         if (hint != NULL && hint->dah_parent != NULL &&
02322             !dt_object_remote(hint->dah_parent))
02323                 parent = hint->dah_parent;
02324 
02325         inode = ldiskfs_create_inode(oth->ot_handle,
02326                                      parent ? osd_dt_obj(parent)->oo_inode :
02327                                               osd_sb(osd)->s_root->d_inode,
02328                                      mode);
02329         if (!IS_ERR(inode)) {
02330                 /* Do not update file c/mtime in ldiskfs. */
02331                 inode->i_flags |= S_NOCMTIME;
02332 
02333                 /* For new created object, it must be consistent,
02334                  * and it is unnecessary to scrub against it. */
02335                 ldiskfs_set_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_NOSCRUB);
02336 
02337                 obj->oo_inode = inode;
02338                 result = 0;
02339         } else {
02340                 if (obj->oo_hl_head != NULL) {
02341                         ldiskfs_htree_lock_head_free(obj->oo_hl_head);
02342                         obj->oo_hl_head = NULL;
02343                 }
02344                 result = PTR_ERR(inode);
02345         }
02346         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
02347         return result;
02348 }
02349 
02350 enum {
02351         OSD_NAME_LEN = 255
02352 };
02353 
02354 static int osd_mkdir(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02355                      struct lu_attr *attr,
02356                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02357                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
02358                      struct thandle *th)
02359 {
02360         int result;
02361         struct osd_thandle *oth;
02362         __u32 mode = (attr->la_mode & (S_IFMT | S_IRWXUGO | S_ISVTX));
02363 
02364         LASSERT(S_ISDIR(attr->la_mode));
02365 
02366         oth = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02367         LASSERT(oth->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
02368         result = osd_mkfile(info, obj, mode, hint, th);
02369 
02370         return result;
02371 }
02372 
02373 static int osd_mk_index(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02374                         struct lu_attr *attr,
02375                         struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02376                         struct dt_object_format *dof,
02377                         struct thandle *th)
02378 {
02379         int result;
02380         struct osd_thandle *oth;
02381         const struct dt_index_features *feat = dof->u.dof_idx.di_feat;
02382 
02383         __u32 mode = (attr->la_mode & (S_IFMT | S_IALLUGO | S_ISVTX));
02384 
02385         LASSERT(S_ISREG(attr->la_mode));
02386 
02387         oth = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02388         LASSERT(oth->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
02389 
02390         result = osd_mkfile(info, obj, mode, hint, th);
02391         if (result == 0) {
02392                 LASSERT(obj->oo_inode != NULL);
02393                 if (feat->dif_flags & DT_IND_VARKEY)
02394                         result = iam_lvar_create(obj->oo_inode,
02395                                                  feat->dif_keysize_max,
02396                                                  feat->dif_ptrsize,
02397                                                  feat->dif_recsize_max,
02398                                                  oth->ot_handle);
02399                 else
02400                         result = iam_lfix_create(obj->oo_inode,
02401                                                  feat->dif_keysize_max,
02402                                                  feat->dif_ptrsize,
02403                                                  feat->dif_recsize_max,
02404                                                  oth->ot_handle);
02405 
02406         }
02407         return result;
02408 }
02409 
02410 static int osd_mkreg(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02411                      struct lu_attr *attr,
02412                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02413                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
02414                      struct thandle *th)
02415 {
02416         LASSERT(S_ISREG(attr->la_mode));
02417         return osd_mkfile(info, obj, (attr->la_mode &
02418                                (S_IFMT | S_IALLUGO | S_ISVTX)), hint, th);
02419 }
02420 
02421 static int osd_mksym(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02422                      struct lu_attr *attr,
02423                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02424                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
02425                      struct thandle *th)
02426 {
02427         LASSERT(S_ISLNK(attr->la_mode));
02428         return osd_mkfile(info, obj, (attr->la_mode &
02429                               (S_IFMT | S_IALLUGO | S_ISVTX)), hint, th);
02430 }
02431 
02432 static int osd_mknod(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02433                      struct lu_attr *attr,
02434                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02435                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
02436                      struct thandle *th)
02437 {
02438         umode_t mode = attr->la_mode & (S_IFMT | S_IALLUGO | S_ISVTX);
02439         int result;
02440 
02441         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
02442         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode == NULL);
02443         LASSERT(S_ISCHR(mode) || S_ISBLK(mode) ||
02444                 S_ISFIFO(mode) || S_ISSOCK(mode));
02445 
02446         result = osd_mkfile(info, obj, mode, hint, th);
02447         if (result == 0) {
02448                 LASSERT(obj->oo_inode != NULL);
02449                 /*
02450                  * This inode should be marked dirty for i_rdev.  Currently
02451                  * that is done in the osd_attr_init().
02452                  */
02453                 init_special_inode(obj->oo_inode, obj->oo_inode->i_mode,
02454                                    attr->la_rdev);
02455         }
02456         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
02457         return result;
02458 }
02459 
02460 typedef int (*osd_obj_type_f)(struct osd_thread_info *, struct osd_object *,
02461                               struct lu_attr *,
02462                               struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02463                               struct dt_object_format *dof,
02464                               struct thandle *);
02465 
02466 static osd_obj_type_f osd_create_type_f(enum dt_format_type type)
02467 {
02468         osd_obj_type_f result;
02469 
02470         switch (type) {
02471         case DFT_DIR:
02472                 result = osd_mkdir;
02473                 break;
02474         case DFT_REGULAR:
02475                 result = osd_mkreg;
02476                 break;
02477         case DFT_SYM:
02478                 result = osd_mksym;
02479                 break;
02480         case DFT_NODE:
02481                 result = osd_mknod;
02482                 break;
02483         case DFT_INDEX:
02484                 result = osd_mk_index;
02485                 break;
02486 
02487         default:
02488                 LBUG();
02489                 break;
02490         }
02491         return result;
02492 }
02493 
02494 
02495 static void osd_ah_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_allocation_hint *ah,
02496                         struct dt_object *parent, struct dt_object *child,
02497                         umode_t child_mode)
02498 {
02499         LASSERT(ah);
02500 
02501         ah->dah_parent = parent;
02502         ah->dah_mode = child_mode;
02503 
02504         if (parent != NULL && !dt_object_remote(parent)) {
02505                 /* will help to find FID->ino at dt_insert("..") */
02506                 struct osd_object *pobj = osd_dt_obj(parent);
02507                 osd_idc_find_and_init(env, osd_obj2dev(pobj), pobj);
02508         }
02509 }
02510 
02511 static void osd_attr_init(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_object *obj,
02512                           struct lu_attr *attr, struct dt_object_format *dof)
02513 {
02514         struct inode   *inode = obj->oo_inode;
02515         __u64           valid = attr->la_valid;
02516         int             result;
02517 
02518         attr->la_valid &= ~(LA_TYPE | LA_MODE);
02519 
02520         if (dof->dof_type != DFT_NODE)
02521                 attr->la_valid &= ~LA_RDEV;
02522         if ((valid & LA_ATIME) && (attr->la_atime == LTIME_S(inode->i_atime)))
02523                 attr->la_valid &= ~LA_ATIME;
02524         if ((valid & LA_CTIME) && (attr->la_ctime == LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime)))
02525                 attr->la_valid &= ~LA_CTIME;
02526         if ((valid & LA_MTIME) && (attr->la_mtime == LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime)))
02527                 attr->la_valid &= ~LA_MTIME;
02528 
02529         result = osd_quota_transfer(inode, attr);
02530         if (result)
02531                 return;
02532 
02533         if (attr->la_valid != 0) {
02534                 result = osd_inode_setattr(info->oti_env, inode, attr);
02535                 /*
02536                  * The osd_inode_setattr() should always succeed here.  The
02537                  * only error that could be returned is EDQUOT when we are
02538                  * trying to change the UID or GID of the inode. However, this
02539                  * should not happen since quota enforcement is no longer
02540                  * enabled on ldiskfs (lquota takes care of it).
02541                  */
02542                 LASSERTF(result == 0, "%d\n", result);
02543                 ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
02544         }
02545 
02546         attr->la_valid = valid;
02547 }
02548 
02554 static int __osd_object_create(struct osd_thread_info *info,
02555                                struct osd_object *obj, struct lu_attr *attr,
02556                                struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02557                                struct dt_object_format *dof,
02558                                struct thandle *th)
02559 {
02560         int     result;
02561         __u32   umask;
02562 
02563         osd_trans_exec_op(info->oti_env, th, OSD_OT_CREATE);
02564 
02565         /* we drop umask so that permissions we pass are not affected */
02566         umask = current->fs->umask;
02567         current->fs->umask = 0;
02568 
02569         result = osd_create_type_f(dof->dof_type)(info, obj, attr, hint, dof,
02570                                                   th);
02571         if (likely(obj->oo_inode != NULL)) {
02572                 LASSERT(obj->oo_inode->i_state & I_NEW);
02573 
02574                 /* Unlock the inode before attr initialization to avoid
02575                  * unnecessary dqget operations. LU-6378 */
02576                 unlock_new_inode(obj->oo_inode);
02577         }
02578 
02579         if (likely(result == 0)) {
02580                 osd_attr_init(info, obj, attr, dof);
02581                 osd_object_init0(obj);
02582         }
02583 
02584         /* restore previous umask value */
02585         current->fs->umask = umask;
02586 
02587         osd_trans_exec_check(info->oti_env, th, OSD_OT_CREATE);
02588 
02589         return result;
02590 }
02591 
02597 static int __osd_oi_insert(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
02598                            const struct lu_fid *fid, struct thandle *th)
02599 {
02600         struct osd_thread_info *info = osd_oti_get(env);
02601         struct osd_inode_id    *id   = &info->oti_id;
02602         struct osd_device      *osd  = osd_obj2dev(obj);
02603         struct osd_thandle     *oh;
02604         int                     rc;
02605 
02606         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode != NULL);
02607 
02608         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02609         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle);
02610         osd_trans_exec_op(env, th, OSD_OT_INSERT);
02611 
02612         osd_id_gen(id, obj->oo_inode->i_ino, obj->oo_inode->i_generation);
02613         rc = osd_oi_insert(info, osd, fid, id, oh->ot_handle, OI_CHECK_FLD);
02614         osd_trans_exec_check(env, th, OSD_OT_INSERT);
02615 
02616         return rc;
02617 }
02618 
02619 int osd_fld_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
02620                    u64 seq, struct lu_seq_range *range)
02621 {
02622         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
02623 
02624         if (fid_seq_is_idif(seq)) {
02625                 fld_range_set_ost(range);
02626                 range->lsr_index = idif_ost_idx(seq);
02627                 return 0;
02628         }
02629 
02630         if (!fid_seq_in_fldb(seq)) {
02631                 fld_range_set_mdt(range);
02632                 if (ss != NULL)
02633                         /* FIXME: If ss is NULL, it suppose not get lsr_index
02634                          * at all */
02635                         range->lsr_index = ss->ss_node_id;
02636                 return 0;
02637         }
02638 
02639         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
02640         fld_range_set_any(range);
02641         /* OSD will only do local fld lookup */
02642         return fld_local_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld, seq, range);
02643 }
02644 
02645 /*
02646  * Concurrency: no external locking is necessary.
02647  */
02648 static int osd_declare_object_create(const struct lu_env *env,
02649                                      struct dt_object *dt,
02650                                      struct lu_attr *attr,
02651                                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02652                                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
02653                                      struct thandle *handle)
02654 {
02655         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
02656         int                      rc;
02657         ENTRY;
02658 
02659         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
02660 
02661         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02662         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
02663 
02664         /* EA object consumes more credits than regular object: osd_mk_index
02665          * vs. osd_mkreg: osd_mk_index will create 2 blocks for root_node and
02666          * leaf_node, could involves the block, block bitmap, groups, GDT
02667          * change for each block, so add 4 * 2 credits in that case. */
02668         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_CREATE,
02669                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_OBJECT_CREATE] +
02670                              (dof->dof_type == DFT_INDEX) ? 4 * 2 : 0);
02671         /* Reuse idle OI block may cause additional one OI block
02672          * to be changed. */
02673         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_INSERT,
02674                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_INSERT] + 1);
02675 
02676         if (!attr)
02677                 RETURN(0);
02678 
02679         rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, attr->la_uid, attr->la_gid, 1, oh,
02680                                    osd_dt_obj(dt), false, NULL, false);
02681         if (rc != 0)
02682                 RETURN(rc);
02683 
02684         /* will help to find FID->ino mapping at dt_insert() */
02685         rc = osd_idc_find_and_init(env, osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt)),
02686                                    osd_dt_obj(dt));
02687 
02688         RETURN(rc);
02689 }
02690 
02691 static int osd_object_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
02692                              struct lu_attr *attr,
02693                              struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
02694                              struct dt_object_format *dof, struct thandle *th)
02695 {
02696         const struct lu_fid     *fid    = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
02697         struct osd_object       *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
02698         struct osd_thread_info  *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
02699         int result;
02700         ENTRY;
02701 
02702         if (dt_object_exists(dt))
02703                 return -EEXIST;
02704 
02705         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
02706         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
02707         LASSERT(osd_write_locked(env, obj));
02708         LASSERT(th != NULL);
02709 
02710         if (unlikely(fid_is_acct(fid)))
02711                 /* Quota files can't be created from the kernel any more,
02712                  * 'tune2fs -O quota' will take care of creating them */
02713                 RETURN(-EPERM);
02714 
02715         result = __osd_object_create(info, obj, attr, hint, dof, th);
02716         if (result == 0) {
02717                 result = __osd_oi_insert(env, obj, fid, th);
02718                 if (obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops == &osd_body_ops_new)
02719                         obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops;
02720         }
02721         LASSERT(ergo(result == 0,
02722                 dt_object_exists(dt) && !dt_object_remote(dt)));
02723 
02724         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
02725         RETURN(result);
02726 }
02727 
02733 static int osd_declare_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
02734                                       struct dt_object *dt,
02735                                       struct thandle *th)
02736 {
02737         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
02738         struct inode       *inode = obj->oo_inode;
02739         struct osd_thandle *oh;
02740         int                 rc;
02741         ENTRY;
02742 
02743         if (inode == NULL)
02744                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
02745 
02746         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02747         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
02748 
02749         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_DESTROY,
02750                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_OBJECT_DELETE]);
02751         /* Recycle idle OI leaf may cause additional three OI blocks
02752          * to be changed. */
02753         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_DELETE,
02754                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_DELETE] + 3);
02755         /* one less inode */
02756         rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, i_uid_read(inode), i_gid_read(inode),
02757                                    -1, oh, obj, false, NULL, false);
02758         if (rc)
02759                 RETURN(rc);
02760         /* data to be truncated */
02761         rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, i_uid_read(inode), i_gid_read(inode),
02762                                    0, oh, obj, true, NULL, false);
02763         if (rc)
02764                 RETURN(rc);
02765 
02766         /* will help to find FID->ino when this object is being
02767          * added to PENDING/ */
02768         rc = osd_idc_find_and_init(env, osd_obj2dev(obj), obj);
02769 
02770         RETURN(rc);
02771 }
02772 
02773 static int osd_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
02774                               struct dt_object *dt,
02775                               struct thandle *th)
02776 {
02777         const struct lu_fid    *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
02778         struct osd_object      *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
02779         struct inode           *inode = obj->oo_inode;
02780         struct osd_device      *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
02781         struct osd_thandle     *oh;
02782         int                     result;
02783         ENTRY;
02784 
02785         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02786         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle);
02787         LASSERT(inode);
02788         LASSERT(!lu_object_is_dying(dt->do_lu.lo_header));
02789 
02790         if (unlikely(fid_is_acct(fid)))
02791                 RETURN(-EPERM);
02792 
02793         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
02794                 LASSERT(osd_inode_unlinked(inode) || inode->i_nlink == 1 ||
02795                         inode->i_nlink == 2);
02796                 /* it will check/delete the inode from remote parent,
02797                  * how to optimize it? unlink performance impaction XXX */
02798                 result = osd_delete_from_remote_parent(env, osd, obj, oh);
02799                 if (result != 0 && result != -ENOENT) {
02800                         CERROR("%s: delete inode "DFID": rc = %d\n",
02801                                osd_name(osd), PFID(fid), result);
02802                 }
02803                 spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
02804                 clear_nlink(inode);
02805                 spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
02806                 ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
02807         }
02808 
02809         osd_trans_exec_op(env, th, OSD_OT_DESTROY);
02810 
02811         ldiskfs_set_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_DESTROY);
02812         result = osd_oi_delete(osd_oti_get(env), osd, fid, oh->ot_handle,
02813                                OI_CHECK_FLD);
02814 
02815         osd_trans_exec_check(env, th, OSD_OT_DESTROY);
02816         /* XXX: add to ext3 orphan list */
02817         /* rc = ext3_orphan_add(handle_t *handle, struct inode *inode) */
02818 
02819         /* not needed in the cache anymore */
02820         set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
02821         obj->oo_destroyed = 1;
02822 
02823         RETURN(0);
02824 }
02825 
02836 int osd_ea_fid_set(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct inode *inode,
02837                    const struct lu_fid *fid, __u32 compat, __u32 incompat)
02838 {
02839         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
02840         int                      rc;
02841         ENTRY;
02842 
02843         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_FID_INLMA))
02844                 RETURN(0);
02845 
02846         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_OST_EA_FID_SET))
02847                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02848 
02849         lustre_lma_init(lma, fid, compat, incompat);
02850         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
02851 
02852         rc = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA, lma, sizeof(*lma),
02853                              XATTR_CREATE);
02854         /* LMA may already exist, but we need to check that all the
02855          * desired compat/incompat flags have been added. */
02856         if (unlikely(rc == -EEXIST)) {
02857                 if (compat == 0 && incompat == 0)
02858                         RETURN(0);
02859 
02860                 rc = __osd_xattr_get(inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry,
02861                                      XATTR_NAME_LMA, info->oti_mdt_attrs_old,
02862                                      LMA_OLD_SIZE);
02863                 if (rc <= 0)
02864                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02865 
02866                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
02867                 if (!(~lma->lma_compat & compat) &&
02868                     !(~lma->lma_incompat & incompat))
02869                         RETURN(0);
02870 
02871                 lma->lma_compat |= compat;
02872                 lma->lma_incompat |= incompat;
02873                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
02874                 rc = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA, lma,
02875                                      sizeof(*lma), XATTR_REPLACE);
02876         }
02877 
02878         RETURN(rc);
02879 }
02880 
02889 static void osd_get_ldiskfs_dirent_param(struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *param,
02890                                          const struct lu_fid *fid)
02891 {
02892         if (!fid_is_namespace_visible(fid) ||
02893             OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_FID_IGIF)) {
02894                 param->edp_magic = 0;
02895                 return;
02896         }
02897 
02898         param->edp_magic = LDISKFS_LUFID_MAGIC;
02899         param->edp_len =  sizeof(struct lu_fid) + 1;
02900         fid_cpu_to_be((struct lu_fid *)param->edp_data, (struct lu_fid *)fid);
02901 }
02902 
02910 static int osd_ea_fid_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
02911                           __u32 ino, struct lu_fid *fid,
02912                           struct osd_inode_id *id)
02913 {
02914         struct osd_thread_info *info  = osd_oti_get(env);
02915         struct inode           *inode;
02916         ENTRY;
02917 
02918         osd_id_gen(id, ino, OSD_OII_NOGEN);
02919         inode = osd_iget_fid(info, osd_obj2dev(obj), id, fid);
02920         if (IS_ERR(inode))
02921                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(inode));
02922 
02923         iput(inode);
02924         RETURN(0);
02925 }
02926 
02927 static int osd_add_dot_dotdot_internal(struct osd_thread_info *info,
02928                                         struct inode *dir,
02929                                         struct inode *parent_dir,
02930                                         const struct lu_fid *dot_fid,
02931                                         const struct lu_fid *dot_dot_fid,
02932                                         struct osd_thandle *oth)
02933 {
02934         struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *dot_ldp;
02935         struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *dot_dot_ldp;
02936         __u32 saved_nlink = dir->i_nlink;
02937         int rc;
02938 
02939         dot_dot_ldp = (struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *)info->oti_ldp2;
02940         osd_get_ldiskfs_dirent_param(dot_dot_ldp, dot_dot_fid);
02941 
02942         dot_ldp = (struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *)info->oti_ldp;
02943         dot_ldp->edp_magic = 0;
02944 
02945         rc = ldiskfs_add_dot_dotdot(oth->ot_handle, parent_dir,
02946                                     dir, dot_ldp, dot_dot_ldp);
02947         /* The ldiskfs_add_dot_dotdot() may dir->i_nlink as 2, then
02948          * the subseqent ref_add() will increase the dir->i_nlink
02949          * as 3. That is incorrect for new created directory.
02950          *
02951          * It looks like hack, because we want to make the OSD API
02952          * to be order-independent for new created directory object
02953          * between dt_insert(..) and ref_add() operations.
02954          *
02955          * Here, we only restore the in-RAM dir-inode's nlink attr,
02956          * becuase if the nlink attr is not 2, then there will be
02957          * ref_add() called following the dt_insert(..), such call
02958          * will make both the in-RAM and on-disk dir-inode's nlink
02959          * attr to be set as 2. LU-7447 */
02960         set_nlink(dir, saved_nlink);
02961         return rc;
02962 }
02963 
02967 static struct inode *osd_create_local_agent_inode(const struct lu_env *env,
02968                                                   struct osd_device *osd,
02969                                                   struct osd_object *pobj,
02970                                                   const struct lu_fid *fid,
02971                                                   __u32 type,
02972                                                   struct thandle *th)
02973 {
02974         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
02975         struct inode            *local;
02976         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
02977         int                     rc;
02978         ENTRY;
02979 
02980         LASSERT(th);
02981         oh = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
02982         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
02983 
02984         local = ldiskfs_create_inode(oh->ot_handle, pobj->oo_inode, type);
02985         if (IS_ERR(local)) {
02986                 CERROR("%s: create local error %d\n", osd_name(osd),
02987                        (int)PTR_ERR(local));
02988                 RETURN(local);
02989         }
02990 
02991         ldiskfs_set_inode_state(local, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_NOSCRUB);
02992         unlock_new_inode(local);
02993 
02994         /* Set special LMA flag for local agent inode */
02995         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, local, fid, 0, LMAI_AGENT);
02996         if (rc != 0) {
02997                 CERROR("%s: set LMA for "DFID" remote inode failed: rc = %d\n",
02998                        osd_name(osd), PFID(fid), rc);
02999                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
03000         }
03001 
03002         if (!S_ISDIR(type))
03003                 RETURN(local);
03004 
03005         rc = osd_add_dot_dotdot_internal(info, local, pobj->oo_inode,
03006                                          lu_object_fid(&pobj->oo_dt.do_lu),
03007                                          fid, oh);
03008         if (rc != 0) {
03009                 CERROR("%s: "DFID" add dot dotdot error: rc = %d\n",
03010                         osd_name(osd), PFID(fid), rc);
03011                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
03012         }
03013 
03014         RETURN(local);
03015 }
03016 
03027 static int osd_schedule_agent_inode_removal(const struct lu_env *env,
03028                                             struct osd_thandle *oh,
03029                                             __u32 ino)
03030 {
03031         struct osd_device      *osd = osd_dt_dev(oh->ot_super.th_dev);
03032         struct osd_obj_orphan *oor;
03033 
03034         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oor);
03035         if (oor == NULL)
03036                 return -ENOMEM;
03037 
03038         oor->oor_ino = ino;
03039         oor->oor_env = (struct lu_env *)env;
03040         spin_lock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
03041         list_add(&oor->oor_list, &osd->od_orphan_list);
03042         spin_unlock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
03043 
03044         oh->ot_remove_agents = 1;
03045 
03046         return 0;
03047 
03048 }
03049 
03050 static int osd_process_scheduled_agent_removals(const struct lu_env *env,
03051                                                 struct osd_device *osd)
03052 {
03053         struct osd_thread_info *info = osd_oti_get(env);
03054         struct osd_obj_orphan *oor, *tmp;
03055         struct osd_inode_id id;
03056         struct list_head list;
03057         struct inode *inode;
03058         struct lu_fid fid;
03059         handle_t *jh;
03060         __u32 ino;
03061 
03062         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&list);
03063 
03064         spin_lock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
03065         list_for_each_entry_safe(oor, tmp, &osd->od_orphan_list, oor_list) {
03066                 if (oor->oor_env == env) {
03067                         list_del(&oor->oor_list);
03068                         list_add(&oor->oor_list, &list);
03069                 }
03070         }
03071         spin_unlock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
03072 
03073         list_for_each_entry_safe(oor, tmp, &list, oor_list) {
03074 
03075                 ino = oor->oor_ino;
03076 
03077                 list_del(&oor->oor_list);
03078                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oor);
03079 
03080                 osd_id_gen(&id, ino, OSD_OII_NOGEN);
03081                 inode = osd_iget_fid(info, osd, &id, &fid);
03082                 if (IS_ERR(inode))
03083                         continue;
03084 
03085                 if (!osd_remote_fid(env, osd, &fid)) {
03086                         iput(inode);
03087                         continue;
03088                 }
03089 
03090                 jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(osd), LDISKFS_HT_MISC, 1);
03091                 clear_nlink(inode);
03092                 mark_inode_dirty(inode);
03093                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
03094                 iput(inode);
03095         }
03096 
03097         return 0;
03098 }
03099 
03108 static int osd_object_ea_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03109                                 struct lu_attr *attr,
03110                                 struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
03111                                 struct dt_object_format *dof,
03112                                 struct thandle *th)
03113 {
03114         const struct lu_fid     *fid    = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
03115         struct osd_object       *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03116         struct osd_thread_info  *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
03117         int                      result, on_ost = 0;
03118 
03119         ENTRY;
03120 
03121         if (dt_object_exists(dt))
03122                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
03123 
03124         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
03125         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03126         LASSERT(osd_write_locked(env, obj));
03127         LASSERT(th != NULL);
03128 
03129         if (unlikely(fid_is_acct(fid)))
03130                 /* Quota files can't be created from the kernel any more,
03131                  * 'tune2fs -O quota' will take care of creating them */
03132                 RETURN(-EPERM);
03133 
03134         result = __osd_object_create(info, obj, attr, hint, dof, th);
03135         if (result == 0) {
03136                 if (fid_is_idif(fid) &&
03137                     !osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev)->od_index_in_idif) {
03138                         struct lu_fid *tfid = &info->oti_fid;
03139                         struct ost_id *oi   = &info->oti_ostid;
03140 
03141                         fid_to_ostid(fid, oi);
03142                         ostid_to_fid(tfid, oi, 0);
03143                         on_ost = 1;
03144                         result = osd_ea_fid_set(info, obj->oo_inode, tfid,
03145                                                 LMAC_FID_ON_OST, 0);
03146                 } else {
03147                         on_ost = fid_is_on_ost(info, osd_obj2dev(obj),
03148                                                fid, OI_CHECK_FLD);
03149                         result = osd_ea_fid_set(info, obj->oo_inode, fid,
03150                                                 on_ost ? LMAC_FID_ON_OST : 0,
03151                                                 0);
03152                 }
03153                 if (obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops == &osd_body_ops_new)
03154                         obj->oo_dt.do_body_ops = &osd_body_ops;
03155         }
03156 
03157         if (result == 0)
03158                 result = __osd_oi_insert(env, obj, fid, th);
03159 
03160         /* a small optimization - dt_insert() isn't usually applied
03161          * to OST objects, so we don't need to cache OI mapping for
03162          * OST objects */
03163         if (result == 0 && on_ost == 0) {
03164                 struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
03165                 result = osd_idc_find_and_init(env, osd, obj);
03166                 LASSERT(result == 0);
03167         }
03168 
03169         LASSERT(ergo(result == 0,
03170                      dt_object_exists(dt) && !dt_object_remote(dt)));
03171         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03172         RETURN(result);
03173 }
03174 
03175 static int osd_declare_object_ref_add(const struct lu_env *env,
03176                                       struct dt_object *dt,
03177                                       struct thandle *handle)
03178 {
03179         struct osd_thandle       *oh;
03180 
03181         /* it's possible that object doesn't exist yet */
03182         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03183 
03184         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03185         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
03186 
03187         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_REF_ADD,
03188                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_ATTR_SET_BASE]);
03189 
03190         return 0;
03191 }
03192 
03193 /*
03194  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
03195  */
03196 static int osd_object_ref_add(const struct lu_env *env,
03197                               struct dt_object *dt, struct thandle *th)
03198 {
03199         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03200         struct inode       *inode = obj->oo_inode;
03201         struct osd_thandle *oh;
03202         int                 rc = 0;
03203 
03204         if (!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed)
03205                 return -ENOENT;
03206 
03207         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03208         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03209         LASSERT(osd_write_locked(env, obj));
03210         LASSERT(th != NULL);
03211 
03212         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03213         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle != NULL);
03214 
03215         osd_trans_exec_op(env, th, OSD_OT_REF_ADD);
03216 
03217         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" increase nlink %d\n",
03218                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), inode->i_nlink);
03219         /*
03220          * The DIR_NLINK feature allows directories to exceed LDISKFS_LINK_MAX
03221          * (65000) subdirectories by storing "1" in i_nlink if the link count
03222          * would otherwise overflow. Directory tranversal tools understand
03223          * that (st_nlink == 1) indicates that the filesystem dose not track
03224          * hard links count on the directory, and will not abort subdirectory
03225          * scanning early once (st_nlink - 2) subdirs have been found.
03226          *
03227          * This also has to properly handle the case of inodes with nlink == 0
03228          * in case they are being linked into the PENDING directory
03229          */
03230         spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
03231         if (unlikely(inode->i_nlink == 0))
03232                 /* inc_nlink from 0 may cause WARN_ON */
03233                 set_nlink(inode, 1);
03234         else {
03235                 ldiskfs_inc_count(oh->ot_handle, inode);
03236                 if (!S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
03237                         LASSERT(inode->i_nlink <= LDISKFS_LINK_MAX);
03238         }
03239         spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
03240 
03241         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
03242         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03243 
03244         osd_trans_exec_check(env, th, OSD_OT_REF_ADD);
03245 
03246         return rc;
03247 }
03248 
03249 static int osd_declare_object_ref_del(const struct lu_env *env,
03250                                       struct dt_object *dt,
03251                                       struct thandle *handle)
03252 {
03253         struct osd_thandle *oh;
03254 
03255         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03256                 return -ENOENT;
03257 
03258         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03259         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03260 
03261         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03262         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
03263 
03264         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_REF_DEL,
03265                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_ATTR_SET_BASE]);
03266 
03267         return 0;
03268 }
03269 
03270 /*
03271  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
03272  */
03273 static int osd_object_ref_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03274                               struct thandle *th)
03275 {
03276         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03277         struct inode            *inode = obj->oo_inode;
03278         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
03279         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
03280 
03281         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03282                 return -ENOENT;
03283 
03284         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03285         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03286         LASSERT(osd_write_locked(env, obj));
03287         LASSERT(th != NULL);
03288 
03289         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03290         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle != NULL);
03291 
03292         osd_trans_exec_op(env, th, OSD_OT_REF_DEL);
03293 
03294         spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
03295         /* That can be result of upgrade from old Lustre version and
03296          * applied only to local files.  Just skip this ref_del call.
03297          * ext4_unlink() only treats this as a warning, don't LASSERT here.*/
03298         if (inode->i_nlink == 0) {
03299                 CDEBUG_LIMIT(fid_is_norm(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)) ?
03300                              D_ERROR : D_INODE, "%s: nlink == 0 on "DFID
03301                              ", maybe an upgraded file? (LU-3915)\n",
03302                              osd_name(osd), PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)));
03303                 spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
03304                 return 0;
03305         }
03306 
03307         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" decrease nlink %d\n",
03308                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), inode->i_nlink);
03309 
03310         ldiskfs_dec_count(oh->ot_handle, inode);
03311         spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
03312 
03313         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
03314         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03315 
03316         osd_trans_exec_check(env, th, OSD_OT_REF_DEL);
03317 
03318         return 0;
03319 }
03320 
03321 /*
03322  * Get the 64-bit version for an inode.
03323  */
03324 static int osd_object_version_get(const struct lu_env *env,
03325                                   struct dt_object *dt, dt_obj_version_t *ver)
03326 {
03327         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
03328 
03329         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Get version "LPX64" for inode %lu\n",
03330                LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_fs_version, inode->i_ino);
03331         *ver = LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_fs_version;
03332         return 0;
03333 }
03334 
03335 /*
03336  * Concurrency: @dt is read locked.
03337  */
03338 static int osd_xattr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03339                          struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name)
03340 {
03341         struct osd_object      *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03342         struct inode           *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
03343         struct osd_thread_info *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
03344         struct dentry          *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
03345 
03346         /* version get is not real XATTR but uses xattr API */
03347         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_VERSION) == 0) {
03348                 /* for version we are just using xattr API but change inode
03349                  * field instead */
03350                 if (buf->lb_len == 0)
03351                         return sizeof(dt_obj_version_t);
03352 
03353                 if (buf->lb_len < sizeof(dt_obj_version_t))
03354                         return -ERANGE;
03355 
03356                 osd_object_version_get(env, dt, buf->lb_buf);
03357 
03358                 return sizeof(dt_obj_version_t);
03359         }
03360 
03361         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03362                 return -ENOENT;
03363 
03364         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03365         LASSERT(inode->i_op != NULL);
03366         LASSERT(inode->i_op->getxattr != NULL);
03367 
03368         return __osd_xattr_get(inode, dentry, name, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
03369 }
03370 
03371 
03372 static int osd_declare_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env,
03373                                  struct dt_object *dt,
03374                                  const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name,
03375                                  int fl, struct thandle *handle)
03376 {
03377         struct osd_thandle *oh;
03378         int credits;
03379         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev));
03380 
03381         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03382 
03383         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03384         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
03385 
03386         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LMA) == 0) {
03387                 /* For non-upgrading case, the LMA is set first and
03388                  * usually fit inode. But for upgrade case, the LMA
03389                  * may be in another separated EA block. */
03390                 if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03391                         credits = 0;
03392                 else if (fl == LU_XATTR_REPLACE)
03393                         credits = 1;
03394                 else
03395                         goto upgrade;
03396         } else if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_VERSION) == 0) {
03397                 credits = 1;
03398         } else {
03399 upgrade:
03400                 credits = osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_XATTR_SET];
03401 
03402                 if (buf != NULL) {
03403                         ssize_t buflen;
03404 
03405                         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL && dt_object_exists(dt)) {
03406                                 /* learn xattr size from osd_xattr_get if
03407                                    attribute has not been read yet */
03408                                 buflen = __osd_xattr_get(
03409                                     osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode,
03410                                     &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_obj_dentry,
03411                                     name, NULL, 0);
03412                                 if (buflen < 0)
03413                                         buflen = 0;
03414                         } else {
03415                                 buflen = buf->lb_len;
03416                         }
03417 
03418                         if (buflen > sb->s_blocksize) {
03419                                 credits += osd_calc_bkmap_credits(
03420                                     sb, NULL, 0, -1,
03421                                     (buflen + sb->s_blocksize - 1) >>
03422                                     sb->s_blocksize_bits);
03423                         }
03424                 }
03425                 /*
03426                  * xattr set may involve inode quota change, reserve credits for
03427                  * dquot_initialize()
03428                  */
03429                 credits += LDISKFS_MAXQUOTAS_INIT_BLOCKS(sb);
03430         }
03431 
03432         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET, credits);
03433 
03434         return 0;
03435 }
03436 
03437 /*
03438  * Set the 64-bit version for object
03439  */
03440 static void osd_object_version_set(const struct lu_env *env,
03441                                    struct dt_object *dt,
03442                                    dt_obj_version_t *new_version)
03443 {
03444         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
03445 
03446         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Set version "LPX64" (old "LPX64") for inode %lu\n",
03447                *new_version, LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_fs_version, inode->i_ino);
03448 
03449         LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_fs_version = *new_version;
03452         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
03453 }
03454 
03455 /*
03456  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
03457  */
03458 static int osd_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03459                          const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name, int fl,
03460                          struct thandle *handle)
03461 {
03462         struct osd_object      *obj      = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03463         struct inode           *inode    = obj->oo_inode;
03464         struct osd_thread_info *info     = osd_oti_get(env);
03465         int                     fs_flags = 0;
03466         int                     rc;
03467         ENTRY;
03468 
03469         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03470 
03471         /* version set is not real XATTR */
03472         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_VERSION) == 0) {
03473                 /* for version we are just using xattr API but change inode
03474                  * field instead */
03475                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len == sizeof(dt_obj_version_t));
03476                 osd_object_version_set(env, dt, buf->lb_buf);
03477                 return sizeof(dt_obj_version_t);
03478         }
03479 
03480         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" set xattr '%s' with size %zu\n",
03481                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), name, buf->lb_len);
03482 
03483         osd_trans_exec_op(env, handle, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET);
03484         if (fl & LU_XATTR_REPLACE)
03485                 fs_flags |= XATTR_REPLACE;
03486 
03487         if (fl & LU_XATTR_CREATE)
03488                 fs_flags |= XATTR_CREATE;
03489 
03490         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LMV) == 0) {
03491                 struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
03492                 int                      rc;
03493 
03494                 rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
03495                 if (rc != 0)
03496                         RETURN(rc);
03497 
03498                 lma->lma_incompat |= LMAI_STRIPED;
03499                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
03500                 rc = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA, lma,
03501                                      sizeof(*lma), XATTR_REPLACE);
03502                 if (rc != 0)
03503                         RETURN(rc);
03504         }
03505 
03506         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_LINKEA_OVERFLOW) &&
03507             strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0)
03508                 return -ENOSPC;
03509 
03510         rc = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, name, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len,
03511                                fs_flags);
03512         osd_trans_exec_check(env, handle, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET);
03513 
03514         return rc;
03515 }
03516 
03517 /*
03518  * Concurrency: @dt is read locked.
03519  */
03520 static int osd_xattr_list(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03521                           const struct lu_buf *buf)
03522 {
03523         struct osd_object      *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03524         struct inode           *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
03525         struct osd_thread_info *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
03526         struct dentry          *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
03527 
03528         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03529                 return -ENOENT;
03530 
03531         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03532         LASSERT(inode->i_op != NULL);
03533         LASSERT(inode->i_op->listxattr != NULL);
03534 
03535         dentry->d_inode = inode;
03536         dentry->d_sb = inode->i_sb;
03537         return inode->i_op->listxattr(dentry, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
03538 }
03539 
03540 static int osd_declare_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env,
03541                                  struct dt_object *dt, const char *name,
03542                                  struct thandle *handle)
03543 {
03544         struct osd_thandle *oh;
03545         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev));
03546 
03547         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03548         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03549 
03550         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
03551         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
03552 
03553         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET,
03554                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_XATTR_SET]);
03555         /*
03556          * xattr del may involve inode quota change, reserve credits for
03557          * dquot_initialize()
03558          */
03559         oh->ot_credits += LDISKFS_MAXQUOTAS_INIT_BLOCKS(sb);
03560 
03561         return 0;
03562 }
03563 
03564 /*
03565  * Concurrency: @dt is write locked.
03566  */
03567 static int osd_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03568                          const char *name, struct thandle *handle)
03569 {
03570         struct osd_object      *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03571         struct inode           *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
03572         struct osd_thread_info *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
03573         struct dentry          *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
03574         int                     rc;
03575 
03576         if (!dt_object_exists(dt))
03577                 return -ENOENT;
03578 
03579         LASSERT(!dt_object_remote(dt));
03580         LASSERT(inode->i_op != NULL);
03581         LASSERT(inode->i_op->removexattr != NULL);
03582         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
03583 
03584         osd_trans_exec_op(env, handle, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET);
03585 
03586         ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
03587         dentry->d_inode = inode;
03588         dentry->d_sb = inode->i_sb;
03589         rc = inode->i_op->removexattr(dentry, name);
03590         osd_trans_exec_check(env, handle, OSD_OT_XATTR_SET);
03591         return rc;
03592 }
03593 
03594 static int osd_object_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03595                            __u64 start, __u64 end)
03596 {
03597         struct osd_object       *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03598         struct inode            *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
03599         struct osd_thread_info  *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
03600         struct dentry           *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
03601         struct file             *file   = &info->oti_file;
03602         int                     rc;
03603 
03604         ENTRY;
03605 
03606         dentry->d_inode = inode;
03607         dentry->d_sb = inode->i_sb;
03608         file->f_path.dentry = dentry;
03609         file->f_mapping = inode->i_mapping;
03610         file->f_op = inode->i_fop;
03611         set_file_inode(file, inode);
03612 
03613         rc = ll_vfs_fsync_range(file, start, end, 0);
03614 
03615         RETURN(rc);
03616 }
03617 
03618 /*
03619  * Index operations.
03620  */
03621 
03622 static int osd_iam_index_probe(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *o,
03623                            const struct dt_index_features *feat)
03624 {
03625         struct iam_descr *descr;
03626 
03627         if (osd_object_is_root(o))
03628                 return feat == &dt_directory_features;
03629 
03630         LASSERT(o->oo_dir != NULL);
03631 
03632         descr = o->oo_dir->od_container.ic_descr;
03633         if (feat == &dt_directory_features) {
03634                 if (descr->id_rec_size == sizeof(struct osd_fid_pack))
03635                         return 1;
03636                 else
03637                         return 0;
03638         } else {
03639                 return
03640                         feat->dif_keysize_min <= descr->id_key_size &&
03641                         descr->id_key_size <= feat->dif_keysize_max &&
03642                         feat->dif_recsize_min <= descr->id_rec_size &&
03643                         descr->id_rec_size <= feat->dif_recsize_max &&
03644                         !(feat->dif_flags & (DT_IND_VARKEY |
03645                                              DT_IND_VARREC | DT_IND_NONUNQ)) &&
03646                         ergo(feat->dif_flags & DT_IND_UPDATE,
03647                              1 /* XXX check that object (and file system) is
03648                                 * writable */);
03649         }
03650 }
03651 
03652 static int osd_iam_container_init(const struct lu_env *env,
03653                                   struct osd_object *obj,
03654                                   struct osd_directory *dir)
03655 {
03656         struct iam_container *bag = &dir->od_container;
03657         int result;
03658 
03659         result = iam_container_init(bag, &dir->od_descr, obj->oo_inode);
03660         if (result != 0)
03661                 return result;
03662 
03663         result = iam_container_setup(bag);
03664         if (result == 0)
03665                 obj->oo_dt.do_index_ops = &osd_index_iam_ops;
03666         else
03667                 iam_container_fini(bag);
03668 
03669         return result;
03670 }
03671 
03672 
03673 /*
03674  * Concurrency: no external locking is necessary.
03675  */
03676 static int osd_index_try(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
03677                          const struct dt_index_features *feat)
03678 {
03679         int                      result;
03680         int                      skip_iam = 0;
03681         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
03682 
03683         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03684 
03685         if (osd_object_is_root(obj)) {
03686                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_index_ea_ops;
03687                 result = 0;
03688         } else if (feat == &dt_directory_features) {
03689                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_index_ea_ops;
03690                 if (obj->oo_inode == NULL || S_ISDIR(obj->oo_inode->i_mode))
03691                         result = 0;
03692                 else
03693                         result = -ENOTDIR;
03694                 skip_iam = 1;
03695         } else if (unlikely(feat == &dt_otable_features)) {
03696                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_otable_ops;
03697                 return 0;
03698         } else if (unlikely(feat == &dt_acct_features)) {
03699                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_acct_index_ops;
03700                 result = 0;
03701                 skip_iam = 1;
03702         } else if (!osd_has_index(obj)) {
03703                 struct osd_directory *dir;
03704 
03705                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(dir);
03706                 if (dir != NULL) {
03707 
03708                         spin_lock(&obj->oo_guard);
03709                         if (obj->oo_dir == NULL)
03710                                 obj->oo_dir = dir;
03711                         else
03712                                 /*
03713                                  * Concurrent thread allocated container data.
03714                                  */
03715                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(dir);
03716                         spin_unlock(&obj->oo_guard);
03717                         /*
03718                          * Now, that we have container data, serialize its
03719                          * initialization.
03720                          */
03721                         down_write(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
03722                         /*
03723                          * recheck under lock.
03724                          */
03725                         if (!osd_has_index(obj))
03726                                 result = osd_iam_container_init(env, obj,
03727                                                                 obj->oo_dir);
03728                         else
03729                                 result = 0;
03730                         up_write(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
03731                 } else {
03732                         result = -ENOMEM;
03733                 }
03734         } else {
03735                 result = 0;
03736         }
03737 
03738         if (result == 0 && skip_iam == 0) {
03739                 if (!osd_iam_index_probe(env, obj, feat))
03740                         result = -ENOTDIR;
03741         }
03742         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
03743 
03744         if (result == 0 && feat == &dt_quota_glb_features &&
03745             fid_seq(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)) == FID_SEQ_QUOTA_GLB)
03746                 result = osd_quota_migration(env, dt);
03747 
03748         return result;
03749 }
03750 
03751 static int osd_otable_it_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env,
03752                                  struct dt_object *dt,
03753                                  struct lu_attr *attr)
03754 {
03755         attr->la_valid = 0;
03756         return 0;
03757 }
03758

03760         .do_read_lock         = osd_object_read_lock,
03761         .do_write_lock        = osd_object_write_lock,
03762         .do_read_unlock       = osd_object_read_unlock,
03763         .do_write_unlock      = osd_object_write_unlock,
03764         .do_write_locked      = osd_object_write_locked,
03765         .do_attr_get          = osd_attr_get,
03766         .do_declare_attr_set  = osd_declare_attr_set,
03767         .do_attr_set          = osd_attr_set,

03769         .do_declare_create    = osd_declare_object_create,
03770         .do_create            = osd_object_create,

03777         .do_ref_del           = osd_object_ref_del,
03778         .do_xattr_get         = osd_xattr_get,
03779         .do_declare_xattr_set = osd_declare_xattr_set,
03780         .do_xattr_set         = osd_xattr_set,
03781         .do_declare_xattr_del = osd_declare_xattr_del,
03782         .do_xattr_del         = osd_xattr_del,
03783         .do_xattr_list        = osd_xattr_list,
03784         .do_object_sync       = osd_object_sync,
03785 };
03786 
03791 static const struct dt_object_operations osd_obj_ea_ops = {
03792         .do_read_lock         = osd_object_read_lock,
03793         .do_write_lock        = osd_object_write_lock,
03794         .do_read_unlock       = osd_object_read_unlock,
03795         .do_write_unlock      = osd_object_write_unlock,
03796         .do_write_locked      = osd_object_write_locked,
03797         .do_attr_get          = osd_attr_get,
03798         .do_declare_attr_set  = osd_declare_attr_set,
03799         .do_attr_set          = osd_attr_set,
03800         .do_ah_init           = osd_ah_init,
03801         .do_declare_create    = osd_declare_object_create,
03802         .do_create            = osd_object_ea_create,
03803         .do_declare_destroy   = osd_declare_object_destroy,
03804         .do_destroy           = osd_object_destroy,

03809         .do_ref_del           = osd_object_ref_del,
03810         .do_xattr_get         = osd_xattr_get,

03812         .do_xattr_set         = osd_xattr_set,
03813         .do_declare_xattr_del = osd_declare_xattr_del,
03814         .do_xattr_del         = osd_xattr_del,
03815         .do_xattr_list        = osd_xattr_list,
03816         .do_object_sync       = osd_object_sync,
