05143 
05150 static struct dt_it *osd_it_ea_init(const struct lu_env *env,
05151                                     struct dt_object *dt,
05152                                     __u32 attr)
05153 {
05154         struct osd_object       *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
05155         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
05156         struct osd_it_ea        *oie;
05157         struct file             *file;
05158         struct lu_object        *lo   = &dt->do_lu;
05159         struct dentry           *obj_dentry;
05160         ENTRY;
05161 
05162         if (!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_destroyed)
05163                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOENT));
05164 
05165         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(oie, osd_itea_cachep, GFP_NOFS);
05166         if (oie == NULL)
05167                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
05168         obj_dentry = &oie->oie_dentry;
05169 
05170         obj_dentry->d_inode = obj->oo_inode;
05171         obj_dentry->d_sb = osd_sb(osd_obj2dev(obj));
05172         obj_dentry->d_name.hash = 0;
05173 
05174         oie->oie_rd_dirent       = 0;
05175         oie->oie_it_dirent       = 0;
05176         oie->oie_dirent          = NULL;
05177         if (unlikely(!info->oti_it_ea_buf_used)) {
05178                 oie->oie_buf = info->oti_it_ea_buf;
05179                 info->oti_it_ea_buf_used = 1;
05180         } else {
05181                 OBD_ALLOC(oie->oie_buf, OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE);
05182                 if (oie->oie_buf == NULL)
05183                         RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
05184         }
05185         oie->oie_obj             = obj;
05186 
05187         file = &oie->oie_file;
05188 
05189         /* Only FMODE_64BITHASH or FMODE_32BITHASH should be set, NOT both. */
05190         if (attr & LUDA_64BITHASH)
05191                 file->f_mode    = FMODE_64BITHASH;
05192         else
05193                 file->f_mode    = FMODE_32BITHASH;
05194         file->f_path.dentry     = obj_dentry;
05195         file->f_mapping         = obj->oo_inode->i_mapping;
05196         file->f_op              = obj->oo_inode->i_fop;
05197         set_file_inode(file, obj->oo_inode);
05198 
05199         lu_object_get(lo);
05200         RETURN((struct dt_it *) oie);
05201 }
05202 
05208 static void osd_it_ea_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
05209 {
05210         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
05211         struct osd_it_ea        *oie    = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05212         struct osd_object       *obj    = oie->oie_obj;
05213         struct inode            *inode  = obj->oo_inode;
05214 
05215         ENTRY;
05216         oie->oie_file.f_op->release(inode, &oie->oie_file);
05217         lu_object_put(env, &obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
05218         if (unlikely(oie->oie_buf != info->oti_it_ea_buf))
05219                 OBD_FREE(oie->oie_buf, OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE);
05220         else
05221                 info->oti_it_ea_buf_used = 0;
05222         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(oie, osd_itea_cachep);
05223         EXIT;
05224 }
05225 
05236 static int osd_it_ea_get(const struct lu_env *env,
05237                          struct dt_it *di, const struct dt_key *key)
05238 {
05239         struct osd_it_ea     *it   = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05240 
05241         ENTRY;
05242         LASSERT(((const char *)key)[0] == '\0');
05243         it->oie_file.f_pos      = 0;
05244         it->oie_rd_dirent       = 0;
05245         it->oie_it_dirent       = 0;
05246         it->oie_dirent          = NULL;
05247 
05248         RETURN(+1);
05249 }
05250 
05254 static void osd_it_ea_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
05255 {
05256 }
05257 
05258 struct osd_filldir_cbs {
05259 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
05260         struct dir_context ctx;
05261 #endif
05262         struct osd_it_ea  *it;
05263 };
05275 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
05276 static int osd_ldiskfs_filldir(struct dir_context  *buf,
05277                                const char *name, int namelen,
05278 #else
05279 static int osd_ldiskfs_filldir(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
05280 #endif
05281                                loff_t offset, __u64 ino,
05282                                unsigned d_type)
05283 {
05284         struct osd_it_ea        *it   =
05285                 ((struct osd_filldir_cbs *)buf)->it;
05286         struct osd_object       *obj  = it->oie_obj;
05287         struct osd_it_ea_dirent *ent  = it->oie_dirent;
05288         struct lu_fid           *fid  = &ent->oied_fid;
05289         struct osd_fid_pack     *rec;
05290         ENTRY;
05291 
05292         /* this should never happen */
05293         if (unlikely(namelen == 0 || namelen > LDISKFS_NAME_LEN)) {
05294                 CERROR("ldiskfs return invalid namelen %d\n", namelen);
05295                 RETURN(-EIO);
05296         }
05297 
05298         if ((void *) ent - it->oie_buf + sizeof(*ent) + namelen >
05299             OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE)
05300                 RETURN(1);
05301 
05302         /* "." is just the object itself. */
05303         if (namelen == 1 && name[0] == '.') {
05304                 *fid = obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header->loh_fid;
05305         } else if (d_type & LDISKFS_DIRENT_LUFID) {
05306                 rec = (struct osd_fid_pack*) (name + namelen + 1);
05307                 if (osd_fid_unpack(fid, rec) != 0)
05308                         fid_zero(fid);
05309         } else {
05310                 fid_zero(fid);
05311         }
05312         d_type &= ~LDISKFS_DIRENT_LUFID;
05313 
05314         /* NOT export local root. */
05315         if (unlikely(osd_sb(osd_obj2dev(obj))->s_root->d_inode->i_ino == ino)) {
05316                 ino = obj->oo_inode->i_ino;
05317                 *fid = obj->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header->loh_fid;
05318         }
05319 
05320         ent->oied_ino     = ino;
05321         ent->oied_off     = offset;
05322         ent->oied_namelen = namelen;
05323         ent->oied_type    = d_type;
05324 
05325         memcpy(ent->oied_name, name, namelen);
05326 
05327         it->oie_rd_dirent++;
05328         it->oie_dirent = (void *) ent + cfs_size_round(sizeof(*ent) + namelen);
05329         RETURN(0);
05330 }
05331 
05342 static int osd_ldiskfs_it_fill(const struct lu_env *env,
05343                                const struct dt_it *di)
05344 {
05345         struct osd_it_ea   *it    = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05346         struct osd_object  *obj   = it->oie_obj;
05347         struct inode       *inode = obj->oo_inode;
05348         struct htree_lock  *hlock = NULL;
05349         struct file        *filp  = &it->oie_file;
05350         int                 rc = 0;
05351         struct osd_filldir_cbs buf = {
05352 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
05353                 .ctx.actor = osd_ldiskfs_filldir,
05354 #endif
05355                 .it = it
05356         };
05357 
05358         ENTRY;
05359         it->oie_dirent = it->oie_buf;
05360         it->oie_rd_dirent = 0;
05361 
05362         if (obj->oo_hl_head != NULL) {
05363                 hlock = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_hlock;
05364                 ldiskfs_htree_lock(hlock, obj->oo_hl_head,
05365                                    inode, LDISKFS_HLOCK_READDIR);
05366         } else {
05367                 down_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05368         }
05369 
05370 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
05371         buf.ctx.pos = filp->f_pos;
05372         rc = inode->i_fop->iterate(filp, &buf.ctx);
05373         filp->f_pos = buf.ctx.pos;
05374 #else
05375         rc = inode->i_fop->readdir(filp, &buf, osd_ldiskfs_filldir);
05376 #endif
05377 
05378         if (hlock != NULL)
05379                 ldiskfs_htree_unlock(hlock);
05380         else
05381                 up_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05382 
05383         if (it->oie_rd_dirent == 0) {
05384                 /*If it does not get any dirent, it means it has been reached
05385                  *to the end of the dir */
05386                 it->oie_file.f_pos = ldiskfs_get_htree_eof(&it->oie_file);
05387                 if (rc == 0)
05388                         rc = 1;
05389         } else {
05390                 it->oie_dirent = it->oie_buf;
05391                 it->oie_it_dirent = 1;
05392         }
05393 
05394         RETURN(rc);
05395 }
05396 
05408 static int osd_it_ea_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
05409 {
05410         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05411         int rc;
05412 
05413         ENTRY;
05414 
05415         if (it->oie_it_dirent < it->oie_rd_dirent) {
05416                 it->oie_dirent =
05417                         (void *) it->oie_dirent +
05418                         cfs_size_round(sizeof(struct osd_it_ea_dirent) +
05419                                        it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen);
05420                 it->oie_it_dirent++;
05421                 RETURN(0);
05422         } else {
05423                 if (it->oie_file.f_pos == ldiskfs_get_htree_eof(&it->oie_file))
05424                         rc = +1;
05425                 else
05426                         rc = osd_ldiskfs_it_fill(env, di);
05427         }
05428 
05429         RETURN(rc);
05430 }
05431 
05439 static struct dt_key *osd_it_ea_key(const struct lu_env *env,
05440                                     const struct dt_it *di)
05441 {
05442         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05443 
05444         return (struct dt_key *)it->oie_dirent->oied_name;
05445 }
05446 
05454 static int osd_it_ea_key_size(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di)
05455 {
05456         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05457 
05458         return it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen;
05459 }
05460 
05461 static inline bool
05462 osd_dot_dotdot_has_space(struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de, int dot_dotdot)
05463 {
05464         LASSERTF(dot_dotdot == 1 || dot_dotdot == 2,
05465                  "dot_dotdot = %d\n", dot_dotdot);
05466 
05467         if (LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(de) >=
05468             __LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(dot_dotdot + 1 + sizeof(struct osd_fid_pack)))
05469                 return true;
05470 
05471         return false;
05472 }
05473 
05474 static inline bool
05475 osd_dirent_has_space(struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de, __u16 namelen,
05476                      unsigned blocksize, int dot_dotdot)
05477 {
05478         if (dot_dotdot > 0)
05479                 return osd_dot_dotdot_has_space(de, dot_dotdot);
05480 
05481         if (ldiskfs_rec_len_from_disk(de->rec_len, blocksize) >=
05482             __LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(namelen + 1 + sizeof(struct osd_fid_pack)))
05483                 return true;
05484 
05485         return false;
05486 }
05487 
05488 static int
05489 osd_dirent_reinsert(const struct lu_env *env, handle_t *jh,
05490                     struct dentry *dentry, const struct lu_fid *fid,
05491                     struct buffer_head *bh, struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de,
05492                     struct htree_lock *hlock, int dot_dotdot)
05493 {
05494         struct inode                *dir        = dentry->d_parent->d_inode;
05495         struct inode                *inode      = dentry->d_inode;
05496         struct osd_fid_pack         *rec;
05497         struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *ldp;
05498         int                          namelen    = dentry->d_name.len;
05499         int                          rc;
05500         struct osd_thread_info     *info        = osd_oti_get(env);
05501         ENTRY;
05502 
05503         if (!LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(inode->i_sb,
05504                                           LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_DIRDATA))
05505                 RETURN(0);
05506 
05507         /* There is enough space to hold the FID-in-dirent. */
05508         if (osd_dirent_has_space(de, namelen, dir->i_sb->s_blocksize,
05509                                  dot_dotdot)) {
05510                 rc = ldiskfs_journal_get_write_access(jh, bh);
05511                 if (rc != 0)
05512                         RETURN(rc);
05513 
05514                 de->name[namelen] = 0;
05515                 rec = (struct osd_fid_pack *)(de->name + namelen + 1);
05516                 rec->fp_len = sizeof(struct lu_fid) + 1;
05517                 fid_cpu_to_be((struct lu_fid *)rec->fp_area, fid);
05518                 de->file_type |= LDISKFS_DIRENT_LUFID;
05519                 rc = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(jh, NULL, bh);
05520 
05521                 RETURN(rc);
05522         }
05523 
05524         LASSERTF(dot_dotdot == 0, "dot_dotdot = %d\n", dot_dotdot);
05525 
05526         rc = ldiskfs_delete_entry(jh, dir, de, bh);
05527         if (rc != 0)
05528                 RETURN(rc);
05529 
05530         ldp = (struct ldiskfs_dentry_param *)osd_oti_get(env)->oti_ldp;
05531         osd_get_ldiskfs_dirent_param(ldp, fid);
05532         dentry->d_fsdata = (void *)ldp;
05533         ll_vfs_dq_init(dir);
05534         rc = osd_ldiskfs_add_entry(info, jh, dentry, inode, hlock);
05535         /* It is too bad, we cannot reinsert the name entry back.
05536          * That means we lose it! */
05537         if (rc != 0)
05538                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to reinsert the dirent, "
05539                        "dir = %lu/%u, name = %.*s, "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05540                        LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
05541                        dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation, namelen,
05542                        dentry->d_name.name, PFID(fid), rc);
05543 
05544         RETURN(rc);
05545 }
05546 
05547 static int
05548 osd_dirent_check_repair(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
05549                         struct osd_it_ea *it, struct lu_fid *fid,
05550                         struct osd_inode_id *id, __u32 *attr)
05551 {
05552         struct osd_thread_info     *info        = osd_oti_get(env);
05553         struct lustre_mdt_attrs    *lma         = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
05554         struct osd_device          *dev         = osd_obj2dev(obj);
05555         struct super_block         *sb          = osd_sb(dev);
05556         const char                 *devname     =
05557                                         LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_es->s_volume_name;
05558         struct osd_it_ea_dirent    *ent         = it->oie_dirent;
05559         struct inode               *dir         = obj->oo_inode;
05560         struct htree_lock          *hlock       = NULL;
05561         struct buffer_head         *bh          = NULL;
05562         handle_t                   *jh          = NULL;
05563         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
05564         struct dentry              *dentry;
05565         struct inode               *inode;
05566         int                         credits;
05567         int                         rc;
05568         int                         dot_dotdot  = 0;
05569         bool                        dirty       = false;
05570         ENTRY;
05571 
05572         osd_id_gen(id, ent->oied_ino, OSD_OII_NOGEN);
05573         inode = osd_iget(info, dev, id);
05574         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
05575                 rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
05576                 if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ESTALE) {
05577                         *attr |= LUDA_UNKNOWN;
05578                         rc = 0;
05579                 } else {
05580                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to iget for dirent "
05581                                "check_repair, dir = %lu/%u, name = %.*s: "
05582                                "rc = %d\n",
05583                                devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation,
05584                                ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name, rc);
05585                 }
05586 
05587                 RETURN(rc);
05588         }
05589 
05590         dentry = osd_child_dentry_by_inode(env, dir, ent->oied_name,
05591                                            ent->oied_namelen);
05592         rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, dentry, lma);
05593         if (rc == -ENODATA)
05594                 lma = NULL;
05595         else if (rc != 0)
05596                 GOTO(out, rc);
05597 
05598         if (ent->oied_name[0] == '.') {
05599                 if (ent->oied_namelen == 1)
05600                         dot_dotdot = 1;
05601                 else if (ent->oied_namelen == 2 && ent->oied_name[1] == '.')
05602                         dot_dotdot = 2;
05603         }
05604 
05605         /* We need to ensure that the name entry is still valid.
05606          * Because it may be removed or renamed by other already.
05607          *
05608          * The unlink or rename operation will start journal before PDO lock,
05609          * so to avoid deadlock, here we need to start journal handle before
05610          * related PDO lock also. But because we do not know whether there
05611          * will be something to be repaired before PDO lock, we just start
05612          * journal without conditions.
05613          *
05614          * We may need to remove the name entry firstly, then insert back.
05615          * One credit is for user quota file update.
05616          * One credit is for group quota file update.
05617          * Two credits are for dirty inode. */
05618         credits = osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_DELETE] +
05619                   osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_INSERT] + 1 + 1 + 2;
05620 
05621         if (dev->od_dirent_journal != 0) {
05622 
05623 again:
05624                 jh = osd_journal_start_sb(sb, LDISKFS_HT_MISC, credits);
05625                 if (IS_ERR(jh)) {
05626                         rc = PTR_ERR(jh);
05627                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to start trans for dirent "
05628                                "check_repair, dir = %lu/%u, credits = %d, "
05629                                "name = %.*s: rc = %d\n",
05630                                devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation, credits,
05631                                ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name, rc);
05632 
05633                         GOTO(out_inode, rc);
05634                 }
05635 
05636                 if (obj->oo_hl_head != NULL) {
05637                         hlock = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_hlock;
05638                         /* "0" means exclusive lock for the whole directory.
05639                          * We need to prevent others access such name entry
05640                          * during the delete + insert. Neither HLOCK_ADD nor
05641                          * HLOCK_DEL cannot guarantee the atomicity. */
05642                         ldiskfs_htree_lock(hlock, obj->oo_hl_head, dir, 0);
05643                 } else {
05644                         down_write(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05645                 }
05646         } else {
05647                 if (obj->oo_hl_head != NULL) {
05648                         hlock = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_hlock;
05649                         ldiskfs_htree_lock(hlock, obj->oo_hl_head, dir,
05650                                            LDISKFS_HLOCK_LOOKUP);
05651                 } else {
05652                         down_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05653                 }
05654         }
05655 
05656         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(dir, &dentry->d_name, &de, NULL, hlock);
05657         /* For dot/dotdot entry, if there is not enough space to hold the
05658          * FID-in-dirent, just keep them there. It only happens when the
05659          * device upgraded from 1.8 or restored from MDT file-level backup.
05660          * For the whole directory, only dot/dotdot entry have no FID-in-dirent
05661          * and needs to get FID from LMA when readdir, it will not affect the
05662          * performance much. */
05663         if ((bh == NULL) || (le32_to_cpu(de->inode) != inode->i_ino) ||
05664             (dot_dotdot != 0 && !osd_dot_dotdot_has_space(de, dot_dotdot))) {
05665                 *attr |= LUDA_IGNORE;
05666 
05667                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05668         }
05669 
05670         if (lma != NULL) {
05671                 if (unlikely(lma->lma_compat & LMAC_NOT_IN_OI)) {
05672                         struct lu_fid *tfid = &lma->lma_self_fid;
05673 
05674                         *attr |= LUDA_IGNORE;
05675                         /* It must be REMOTE_PARENT_DIR and as the
05676                          * dotdot entry of remote directory */
05677                         if (unlikely(dot_dotdot != 2 ||
05678                                      fid_seq(tfid) != FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE ||
05679                                      fid_oid(tfid) != REMOTE_PARENT_DIR_OID)) {
05680                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: expect remote agent "
05681                                        "parent directory, but got %.*s under "
05682                                        "dir = %lu/%u with the FID "DFID"\n",
05683                                        devname, ent->oied_namelen,
05684                                        ent->oied_name, dir->i_ino,
05685                                        dir->i_generation, PFID(tfid));
05686 
05687                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
05688                         }
05689 
05690                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05691                 }
05692 
05693                 if (fid_is_sane(fid)) {
05694                         /* FID-in-dirent is valid. */
05695                         if (lu_fid_eq(fid, &lma->lma_self_fid))
05696                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05697 
05698                         /* Do not repair under dryrun mode. */
05699                         if (*attr & LUDA_VERIFY_DRYRUN) {
05700                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05701 
05702                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05703                         }
05704 
05705                         if (jh == NULL) {
05706                                 brelse(bh);
05707                                 dev->od_dirent_journal = 1;
05708                                 if (hlock != NULL) {
05709                                         ldiskfs_htree_unlock(hlock);
05710                                         hlock = NULL;
05711                                 } else {
05712                                         up_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05713                                 }
05714 
05715                                 goto again;
05716                         }
05717 
05718                         *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
05719                         dirty = true;
05720                         /* Update the FID-in-dirent. */
05721                         rc = osd_dirent_reinsert(env, jh, dentry, fid, bh, de,
05722                                                  hlock, dot_dotdot);
05723                         if (rc == 0)
05724                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05725                         else
05726                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to update FID "
05727                                        "in the dirent, dir = %lu/%u, "
05728                                        "name = %.*s, "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05729                                        devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation,
05730                                        ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name,
05731                                        PFID(fid), rc);
05732                 } else {
05733                         /* Do not repair under dryrun mode. */
05734                         if (*attr & LUDA_VERIFY_DRYRUN) {
05735                                 *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
05736                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05737 
05738                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05739                         }
05740 
05741                         if (jh == NULL) {
05742                                 brelse(bh);
05743                                 dev->od_dirent_journal = 1;
05744                                 if (hlock != NULL) {
05745                                         ldiskfs_htree_unlock(hlock);
05746                                         hlock = NULL;
05747                                 } else {
05748                                         up_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05749                                 }
05750 
05751                                 goto again;
05752                         }
05753 
05754                         *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
05755                         dirty = true;
05756                         /* Append the FID-in-dirent. */
05757                         rc = osd_dirent_reinsert(env, jh, dentry, fid, bh, de,
05758                                                  hlock, dot_dotdot);
05759                         if (rc == 0)
05760                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05761                         else
05762                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to append FID "
05763                                        "after the dirent, dir = %lu/%u, "
05764                                        "name = %.*s, "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05765                                        devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation,
05766                                        ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name,
05767                                        PFID(fid), rc);
05768                 }
05769         } else {
05770                 /* Do not repair under dryrun mode. */
05771                 if (*attr & LUDA_VERIFY_DRYRUN) {
05772                         if (fid_is_sane(fid)) {
05773                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05774                         } else {
05775                                 lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino,
05776                                               inode->i_generation);
05777                                 *attr |= LUDA_UPGRADE;
05778                         }
05779 
05780                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
05781                 }
05782 
05783                 if (jh == NULL) {
05784                         brelse(bh);
05785                         dev->od_dirent_journal = 1;
05786                         if (hlock != NULL) {
05787                                 ldiskfs_htree_unlock(hlock);
05788                                 hlock = NULL;
05789                         } else {
05790                                 up_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05791                         }
05792 
05793                         goto again;
05794                 }
05795 
05796                 dirty = true;
05797                 if (unlikely(fid_is_sane(fid))) {
05798                         /* FID-in-dirent exists, but FID-in-LMA is lost.
05799                          * Trust the FID-in-dirent, and add FID-in-LMA. */
05800                         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid, 0, 0);
05801                         if (rc == 0)
05802                                 *attr |= LUDA_REPAIR;
05803                         else
05804                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to set LMA for "
05805                                        "update dirent, dir = %lu/%u, "
05806                                        "name = %.*s, "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05807                                        devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation,
05808                                        ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name,
05809                                        PFID(fid), rc);
05810                 } else {
05811                         lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
05812                         /* It is probably IGIF object. Only aappend the
05813                          * FID-in-dirent. OI scrub will process FID-in-LMA. */
05814                         rc = osd_dirent_reinsert(env, jh, dentry, fid, bh, de,
05815                                                  hlock, dot_dotdot);
05816                         if (rc == 0)
05817                                 *attr |= LUDA_UPGRADE;
05818                         else
05819                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to append IGIF "
05820                                        "after the dirent, dir = %lu/%u, "
05821                                        "name = %.*s, "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05822                                        devname, dir->i_ino, dir->i_generation,
05823                                        ent->oied_namelen, ent->oied_name,
05824                                        PFID(fid), rc);
05825                 }
05826         }
05827 
05828         GOTO(out, rc);
05829 
05830 out:
05831         brelse(bh);
05832         if (hlock != NULL) {
05833                 ldiskfs_htree_unlock(hlock);
05834         } else {
05835                 if (dev->od_dirent_journal != 0)
05836                         up_write(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05837                 else
05838                         up_read(&obj->oo_ext_idx_sem);
05839         }
05840 
05841         if (jh != NULL)
05842                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
05843 
05844 out_inode:
05845         iput(inode);
05846         if (rc >= 0 && !dirty)
05847                 dev->od_dirent_journal = 0;
05848 
05849         return rc;
05850 }
05851 
05862 static inline int osd_it_ea_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
05863                                 const struct dt_it *di,
05864                                 struct dt_rec *dtrec, __u32 attr)
05865 {
05866         struct osd_it_ea       *it    = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05867         struct osd_object      *obj   = it->oie_obj;
05868         struct osd_device      *dev   = osd_obj2dev(obj);
05869         struct osd_thread_info *oti   = osd_oti_get(env);
05870         struct osd_inode_id    *id    = &oti->oti_id;
05871         struct lu_fid          *fid   = &it->oie_dirent->oied_fid;
05872         struct lu_dirent       *lde   = (struct lu_dirent *)dtrec;
05873         __u32                   ino   = it->oie_dirent->oied_ino;
05874         int                     rc    = 0;
05875         ENTRY;
05876 
05877         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode != dev->od_mdt_map->omm_remote_parent->d_inode);
05878 
05879         if (attr & LUDA_VERIFY) {
05880                 if (unlikely(ino == osd_remote_parent_ino(dev))) {
05881                         attr |= LUDA_IGNORE;
05882                         /* If the parent is on remote MDT, and there
05883                          * is no FID-in-dirent, then we have to get
05884                          * the parent FID from the linkEA.  */
05885                         if (!fid_is_sane(fid) &&
05886                             it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen == 2 &&
05887                             it->oie_dirent->oied_name[0] == '.' &&
05888                             it->oie_dirent->oied_name[1] == '.')
05889                                 osd_get_pfid_from_linkea(env, obj, fid);
05890                 } else {
05891                         rc = osd_dirent_check_repair(env, obj, it, fid, id,
05892                                                      &attr);
05893                 }
05894 
05895                 if (!fid_is_sane(fid)) {
05896                         attr &= ~LUDA_IGNORE;
05897                         attr |= LUDA_UNKNOWN;
05898                 }
05899         } else {
05900                 attr &= ~LU_DIRENT_ATTRS_MASK;
05901                 if (!fid_is_sane(fid)) {
05902                         bool is_dotdot = false;
05903                         if (it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen == 2 &&
05904                             it->oie_dirent->oied_name[0] == '.' &&
05905                             it->oie_dirent->oied_name[1] == '.')
05906                                 is_dotdot = true;
05907                         /* If the parent is on remote MDT, and there
05908                          * is no FID-in-dirent, then we have to get
05909                          * the parent FID from the linkEA.  */
05910                         if (ino == osd_remote_parent_ino(dev) && is_dotdot) {
05911                                 rc = osd_get_pfid_from_linkea(env, obj, fid);
05912                         } else {
05913                                 if (is_dotdot == false &&
05914                                     OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_FID_LOOKUP))
05915                                         RETURN(-ENOENT);
05916 
05917                                 rc = osd_ea_fid_get(env, obj, ino, fid, id);
05918                         }
05919                 } else {
05920                         osd_id_gen(id, ino, OSD_OII_NOGEN);
05921                 }
05922         }
05923 
05924         /* Pack the entry anyway, at least the offset is right. */
05925         osd_it_pack_dirent(lde, fid, it->oie_dirent->oied_off,
05926                            it->oie_dirent->oied_name,
05927                            it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen,
05928                            it->oie_dirent->oied_type, attr);
05929 
05930         if (rc < 0)
05931                 RETURN(rc);
05932 
05933         if (osd_remote_fid(env, dev, fid))
05934                 RETURN(0);
05935 
05936         if (likely(!(attr & (LUDA_IGNORE | LUDA_UNKNOWN)) && rc == 0))
05937                 osd_add_oi_cache(oti, dev, id, fid);
05938 
05939         RETURN(rc > 0 ? 0 : rc);
05940 }
05941 
05955 static int osd_it_ea_rec_size(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
05956                               __u32 attr)
05957 {
05958         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05959 
05960         return lu_dirent_calc_size(it->oie_dirent->oied_namelen, attr);
05961 }
05962 
05971 static __u64 osd_it_ea_store(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di)
05972 {
05973         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05974 
05975         return it->oie_dirent->oied_off;
05976 }
05977 
05988 static int osd_it_ea_load(const struct lu_env *env,
05989                           const struct dt_it *di, __u64 hash)
05990 {
05991         struct osd_it_ea *it = (struct osd_it_ea *)di;
05992         int rc;
05993 
05994         ENTRY;
05995         it->oie_file.f_pos = hash;
05996 
05997         rc =  osd_ldiskfs_it_fill(env, di);
05998         if (rc > 0)
05999                 rc = -ENODATA;
06000 
06001         if (rc == 0)
06002                 rc = +1;
06003 
06004         RETURN(rc);
06005 }
06006 
06015 static int osd_index_ea_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
06016                                struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key)
06017 {
06018         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
06019         int rc = 0;
06020 
06021         ENTRY;
06022 
06023         LASSERT(S_ISDIR(obj->oo_inode->i_mode));
06024         LINVRNT(osd_invariant(obj));
06025 
06026         rc = osd_ea_lookup_rec(env, obj, rec, key);
06027         if (rc == 0)
06028                 rc = +1;
06029         RETURN(rc);
06030 }
06031 
06036 static const struct dt_index_operations osd_index_ea_ops = {
06037         .dio_lookup         = osd_index_ea_lookup,
06038         .dio_declare_insert = osd_index_declare_ea_insert,
06039         .dio_insert         = osd_index_ea_insert,
06040         .dio_declare_delete = osd_index_declare_ea_delete,
06041         .dio_delete         = osd_index_ea_delete,
06042         .dio_it     = {
06043                 .init     = osd_it_ea_init,
06044                 .fini     = osd_it_ea_fini,
06045                 .get      = osd_it_ea_get,
06046                 .put      = osd_it_ea_put,
06047                 .next     = osd_it_ea_next,
06048                 .key      = osd_it_ea_key,
06049                 .key_size = osd_it_ea_key_size,
06050                 .rec      = osd_it_ea_rec,
06051                 .rec_size = osd_it_ea_rec_size,
06052                 .store    = osd_it_ea_store,
06053                 .load     = osd_it_ea_load
06054         }
06055 };
06056 
06057 static void *osd_key_init(const struct lu_context *ctx,
06058                           struct lu_context_key *key)
06059 {
06060         struct osd_thread_info *info;
06061 
06062         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(info);
06063         if (info == NULL)
06064                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
06065 
06066         OBD_ALLOC(info->oti_it_ea_buf, OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE);
06067         if (info->oti_it_ea_buf == NULL)
06068                 goto out_free_info;
06069 
06070         info->oti_env = container_of(ctx, struct lu_env, le_ctx);
06071 
06072         info->oti_hlock = ldiskfs_htree_lock_alloc();
06073         if (info->oti_hlock == NULL)
06074                 goto out_free_ea;
06075 
06076         return info;
06077 
06078  out_free_ea:
06079         OBD_FREE(info->oti_it_ea_buf, OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE);
06080  out_free_info:
06081         OBD_FREE_PTR(info);
06082         return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
06083 }
06084 
06085 static void osd_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,
06086                          struct lu_context_key *key, void* data)
06087 {
06088         struct osd_thread_info *info = data;
06089         struct ldiskfs_inode_info *lli = LDISKFS_I(info->oti_inode);
06090         struct osd_idmap_cache  *idc = info->oti_ins_cache;
06091 
06092         if (info->oti_inode != NULL)
06093                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lli);
06094         if (info->oti_hlock != NULL)
06095                 ldiskfs_htree_lock_free(info->oti_hlock);
06096         OBD_FREE(info->oti_it_ea_buf, OSD_IT_EA_BUFSIZE);
06097         lu_buf_free(&info->oti_iobuf.dr_pg_buf);
06098         lu_buf_free(&info->oti_iobuf.dr_bl_buf);
06099         lu_buf_free(&info->oti_big_buf);
06100         if (idc != NULL) {
06101                 LASSERT(info->oti_ins_cache_size > 0);
06102                 OBD_FREE(idc, sizeof(*idc) * info->oti_ins_cache_size);
06103                 info->oti_ins_cache = NULL;
06104                 info->oti_ins_cache_size = 0;
06105         }
06106         OBD_FREE_PTR(info);
06107 }
06108 
06109 static void osd_key_exit(const struct lu_context *ctx,
06110                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
06111 {
06112         struct osd_thread_info *info = data;
06113 
06114         LASSERT(info->oti_r_locks == 0);
06115         LASSERT(info->oti_w_locks == 0);
06116         LASSERT(info->oti_txns    == 0);
06117 }
06118 
06119 /* type constructor/destructor: osd_type_init, osd_type_fini */
06120 LU_TYPE_INIT_FINI(osd, &osd_key);
06121 
06122 struct lu_context_key osd_key = {
06123         .lct_tags = LCT_DT_THREAD | LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_MG_THREAD | LCT_LOCAL,
06124         .lct_init = osd_key_init,
06125         .lct_fini = osd_key_fini,
06126         .lct_exit = osd_key_exit
06127 };
06128 
06129 
06130 static int osd_device_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *d,
06131                            const char *name, struct lu_device *next)
06132 {
06133         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(d);
06134 
06135         if (strlcpy(osd->od_svname, name, sizeof(osd->od_svname))
06136             >= sizeof(osd->od_svname))
06137                 return -E2BIG;
06138         return osd_procfs_init(osd, name);
06139 }
06140 
06141 static int osd_fid_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
06142 {
06143         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
06144         int                     rc;
06145         ENTRY;
06146 
06147         if (osd->od_is_ost || osd->od_cl_seq != NULL)
06148                 RETURN(0);
06149 
06150         if (unlikely(ss == NULL))
06151                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
06152 
06153         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
06154         if (osd->od_cl_seq == NULL)
06155                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
06156 
06157         rc = seq_client_init(osd->od_cl_seq, NULL, LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA,
06158                              osd->od_svname, ss->ss_server_seq);
06159         if (rc != 0) {
06160                 OBD_FREE_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
06161                 osd->od_cl_seq = NULL;
06162                 RETURN(rc);
06163         }
06164 
06165         if (ss->ss_node_id == 0) {
06166                 /* If the OSD on the sequence controller(MDT0), then allocate
06167                  * sequence here, otherwise allocate sequence after connected
06168                  * to MDT0 (see mdt_register_lwp_callback()). */
06169                 rc = seq_server_alloc_meta(osd->od_cl_seq->lcs_srv,
06170                                    &osd->od_cl_seq->lcs_space, env);
06171         }
06172 
06173         RETURN(rc);
06174 }
06175 
06176 static void osd_fid_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
06177 {
06178         if (osd->od_cl_seq == NULL)
06179                 return;
06180 
06181         seq_client_fini(osd->od_cl_seq);
06182         OBD_FREE_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
06183         osd->od_cl_seq = NULL;
06184 }
06185 
06186 static int osd_shutdown(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
06187 {
06188         ENTRY;
06189 
06190         /* shutdown quota slave instance associated with the device */
06191         if (o->od_quota_slave != NULL) {
06192                 qsd_fini(env, o->od_quota_slave);
06193                 o->od_quota_slave = NULL;
06194         }
06195 
06196         osd_fid_fini(env, o);
06197 
06198         RETURN(0);
06199 }
06200 
06201 static void osd_umount(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
06202 {
06203         ENTRY;
06204 
06205         if (o->od_mnt != NULL) {
06206                 shrink_dcache_sb(osd_sb(o));
06207                 osd_sync(env, &o->od_dt_dev);
06208 
06209                 mntput(o->od_mnt);
06210                 o->od_mnt = NULL;
06211         }
06212 
06213         EXIT;
06214 }
06215 
06216 static int osd_mount(const struct lu_env *env,
06217                      struct osd_device *o, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
06218 {
06219         const char              *name  = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
06220         const char              *dev  = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1);
06221         const char              *opts;
06222         unsigned long            page, s_flags, lmd_flags = 0;
06223         struct page             *__page;
06224         struct file_system_type *type;
06225         char                    *options = NULL;
06226         char                    *str;
06227         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
06228         struct lu_fid           *fid = &info->oti_fid;
06229         struct inode            *inode;
06230         int                      rc = 0, force_over_256tb = 0;
06231         ENTRY;
06232 
06233         if (o->od_mnt != NULL)
06234                 RETURN(0);
06235 
06236         if (strlen(dev) >= sizeof(o->od_mntdev))
06237                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
06238         strcpy(o->od_mntdev, dev);
06239 
06240         str = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 2);
06241         s_flags = simple_strtoul(str, NULL, 0);
06242         str = strstr(str, ":");
06243         if (str)
06244                 lmd_flags = simple_strtoul(str + 1, NULL, 0);
06245         opts = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 3);
06246 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
06247         if (opts == NULL || strstr(opts, "bigendian_extents") == NULL) {
06248                 CERROR("%s: device %s extents feature is not guaranteed to "
06249                        "work on big-endian systems. Use \"bigendian_extents\" "
06250                        "mount option to override.\n", name, dev);
06251                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
06252         }
06253 #endif
06254         if (opts != NULL && strstr(opts, "force_over_128tb") != NULL) {
06255                 CWARN("force_over_128tb option is depricated."
06256                       "Filesystems less then 256TB can be created without any"
06257                       "force options. Use force_over_256tb option for"
06258                       "filesystems greather then 256TB.\n");
06259         }
06260 
06261         if (opts != NULL && strstr(opts, "force_over_256tb") != NULL)
06262                 force_over_256tb = 1;
06263 
06264         __page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
06265         if (__page == NULL)
06266                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
06267         page = (unsigned long)page_address(__page);
06268         options = (char *)page;
06269         *options = '\0';
06270         if (opts != NULL) {
06271                 /* strip out the options for back compatiblity */
06272                 static char *sout[] = {
06273                         "mballoc",
06274                         "iopen",
06275                         "noiopen",
06276                         "iopen_nopriv",
06277                         "extents",
06278                         "noextents",
06279                         /* strip out option we processed in osd */
06280                         "bigendian_extents",
06281 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(3,0,53,0)
06282 #warning "remove force_over_128 option"
06283 #else
06284                         "force_over_128tb (deprecated)",
06285 #endif
06286                         "force_over_256tb",
06287                         NULL
06288                 };
06289                 strcat(options, opts);
06290                 for (rc = 0, str = options; sout[rc]; ) {
06291                         char *op = strstr(str, sout[rc]);
06292                         if (op == NULL) {
06293                                 rc++;
06294                                 str = options;
06295                                 continue;
06296                         }
06297                         if (op == options || *(op - 1) == ',') {
06298                                 str = op + strlen(sout[rc]);
06299                                 if (*str == ',' || *str == '\0') {
06300                                         *str == ',' ? str++ : str;
06301                                         memmove(op, str, strlen(str) + 1);
06302                                 }
06303                         }
06304                         for (str = op; *str != ',' && *str != '\0'; str++)
06305                                 ;
06306                 }
06307         } else {
06308                 strncat(options, "user_xattr,acl", 14);
06309         }
06310 
06311         /* Glom up mount options */
06312         if (*options != '\0')
06313                 strcat(options, ",");
06314         strlcat(options, "no_mbcache", PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
06315 
06316         type = get_fs_type("ldiskfs");
06317         if (!type) {
06318                 CERROR("%s: cannot find ldiskfs module\n", name);
06319                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
06320         }
06321 
06322         o->od_mnt = vfs_kern_mount(type, s_flags, dev, options);
06323         module_put(type->owner);
06324 
06325         if (IS_ERR(o->od_mnt)) {
06326                 rc = PTR_ERR(o->od_mnt);
06327                 o->od_mnt = NULL;
06328                 CERROR("%s: can't mount %s: %d\n", name, dev, rc);
06329                 GOTO(out, rc);
06330         }
06331 
06332         if (ldiskfs_blocks_count(LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(o))->s_es) > (64ULL << 30) &&
06333             force_over_256tb == 0) {
06334                 CERROR("%s: device %s LDISKFS does not support filesystems "
06335                        "greater than 256TB and can cause data corruption. "
06336                        "Use \"force_over_256tb\" mount option to override.\n",
06337                        name, dev);
06338                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
06339         }
06340 
06341 #ifdef HAVE_DEV_SET_RDONLY
06342         if (dev_check_rdonly(o->od_mnt->mnt_sb->s_bdev)) {
06343                 CERROR("%s: underlying device %s is marked as read-only. "
06344                        "Setup failed\n", name, dev);
06345                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc = -EROFS);
06346         }
06347 #endif
06348 
06349         if (!LDISKFS_HAS_COMPAT_FEATURE(o->od_mnt->mnt_sb,
06350                                         LDISKFS_FEATURE_COMPAT_HAS_JOURNAL)) {
06351                 CERROR("%s: device %s is mounted w/o journal\n", name, dev);
06352                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc = -EINVAL);
06353         }
06354 
06355 #ifdef LDISKFS_MOUNT_DIRDATA
06356         if (LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(o->od_mnt->mnt_sb,
06357                                          LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_DIRDATA))
06358                 LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(o))->s_mount_opt |= LDISKFS_MOUNT_DIRDATA;
06359         else if (!o->od_is_ost)
06360                 CWARN("%s: device %s was upgraded from Lustre-1.x without "
06361                       "enabling the dirdata feature. If you do not want to "
06362                       "downgrade to Lustre-1.x again, you can enable it via "
06363                       "'tune2fs -O dirdata device'\n", name, dev);
06364 #endif
06365         inode = osd_sb(o)->s_root->d_inode;
06366         lu_local_obj_fid(fid, OSD_FS_ROOT_OID);
06367         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid, LMAC_NOT_IN_OI, 0);
06368         if (rc != 0) {
06369                 CERROR("%s: failed to set lma on %s root inode\n", name, dev);
06370                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
06371         }
06372 
06373         if (lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOSCRUB)
06374                 o->od_noscrub = 1;
06375 
06376         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
06377 
06378 out_mnt:
06379         mntput(o->od_mnt);
06380         o->od_mnt = NULL;
06381 
06382 out:
06383         if (__page)
06384                 __free_page(__page);
06385 
06386         return rc;
06387 }
06388 
06389 static struct lu_device *osd_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
06390                                          struct lu_device *d)
06391 {
06392         struct osd_device *o = osd_dev(d);
06393         ENTRY;
06394 
06395         osd_shutdown(env, o);
06396         osd_procfs_fini(o);
06397         osd_scrub_cleanup(env, o);
06398         osd_obj_map_fini(o);
06399         osd_umount(env, o);
06400 
06401         RETURN(NULL);
06402 }
06403 
06404 static int osd_device_init0(const struct lu_env *env,
06405                             struct osd_device *o,
06406                             struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
06407 {
06408         struct lu_device        *l = osd2lu_dev(o);
06409         struct osd_thread_info *info;
06410         int                     rc;
06411         int                     cplen = 0;
06412 
06413         /* if the module was re-loaded, env can loose its keys */
06414         rc = lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *) env);
06415         if (rc)
06416                 GOTO(out, rc);
06417         info = osd_oti_get(env);
06418         LASSERT(info);
06419 
06420         l->ld_ops = &osd_lu_ops;
06421         o->od_dt_dev.dd_ops = &osd_dt_ops;
06422 
06423         spin_lock_init(&o->od_osfs_lock);
06424         mutex_init(&o->od_otable_mutex);
06425         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&o->od_orphan_list);
06426 
06427         o->od_read_cache = 1;
06428         o->od_writethrough_cache = 1;
06429         o->od_readcache_max_filesize = OSD_MAX_CACHE_SIZE;
06430 
06431         cplen = strlcpy(o->od_svname, lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 4),
06432                         sizeof(o->od_svname));
06433         if (cplen >= sizeof(o->od_svname)) {
06434                 rc = -E2BIG;
06435                 GOTO(out, rc);
06436         }
06437 
06438         o->od_index = -1; /* -1 means index is invalid */
06439         rc = server_name2index(o->od_svname, &o->od_index, NULL);
06440         if (rc == LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
06441                 o->od_is_ost = 1;
06442 
06443         o->od_full_scrub_ratio = OFSR_DEFAULT;
06444         o->od_full_scrub_threshold_rate = FULL_SCRUB_THRESHOLD_RATE_DEFAULT;
06445         rc = osd_mount(env, o, cfg);
06446         if (rc != 0)
06447                 GOTO(out, rc);
06448 
06449         rc = osd_obj_map_init(env, o);
06450         if (rc != 0)
06451                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
06452 
06453         rc = lu_site_init(&o->od_site, l);
06454         if (rc != 0)
06455                 GOTO(out_compat, rc);
06456         o->od_site.ls_bottom_dev = l;
06457 
06458         rc = lu_site_init_finish(&o->od_site);
06459         if (rc != 0)
06460                 GOTO(out_site, rc);
06461 
06462         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&o->od_ios_list);
06463         /* setup scrub, including OI files initialization */
06464         rc = osd_scrub_setup(env, o);
06465         if (rc < 0)
06466                 GOTO(out_site, rc);
06467 
06468         rc = osd_procfs_init(o, o->od_svname);
06469         if (rc != 0) {
06470                 CERROR("%s: can't initialize procfs: rc = %d\n",
06471                        o->od_svname, rc);
06472                 GOTO(out_scrub, rc);
06473         }
06474 
06475         LASSERT(l->ld_site->ls_linkage.next != NULL);
06476         LASSERT(l->ld_site->ls_linkage.prev != NULL);
06477 
06478         /* initialize quota slave instance */
06479         o->od_quota_slave = qsd_init(env, o->od_svname, &o->od_dt_dev,
06480                                      o->od_proc_entry);
06481         if (IS_ERR(o->od_quota_slave)) {
06482                 rc = PTR_ERR(o->od_quota_slave);
06483                 o->od_quota_slave = NULL;
06484                 GOTO(out_procfs, rc);
06485         }
06486 
06487         RETURN(0);
06488 
06489 out_procfs:
06490         osd_procfs_fini(o);
06491 out_scrub:
06492         osd_scrub_cleanup(env, o);
06493 out_site:
06494         lu_site_fini(&o->od_site);
06495 out_compat:
06496         osd_obj_map_fini(o);
06497 out_mnt:
06498         osd_umount(env, o);
06499 out:
06500         return rc;
06501 }
06502 
06503 static struct lu_device *osd_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
06504                                           struct lu_device_type *t,
06505                                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
06506 {
06507         struct osd_device *o;
06508         int                rc;
06509 
06510         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(o);
06511         if (o == NULL)
06512                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
06513 
06514         rc = dt_device_init(&o->od_dt_dev, t);
06515         if (rc == 0) {
06516                 /* Because the ctx might be revived in dt_device_init,
06517                  * refill the env here */
06518                 lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
06519                 rc = osd_device_init0(env, o, cfg);
06520                 if (rc)
06521                         dt_device_fini(&o->od_dt_dev);
06522         }
06523 
06524         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
06525                 OBD_FREE_PTR(o);
06526 
06527         return rc == 0 ? osd2lu_dev(o) : ERR_PTR(rc);
06528 }
06529 
06530 static struct lu_device *osd_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
06531                                          struct lu_device *d)
06532 {
06533         struct osd_device *o = osd_dev(d);
06534         ENTRY;
06535 
06536         /* XXX: make osd top device in order to release reference */
06537         d->ld_site->ls_top_dev = d;
06538         lu_site_purge(env, d->ld_site, -1);
06539         if (!cfs_hash_is_empty(d->ld_site->ls_obj_hash)) {
06540                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
06541                 lu_site_print(env, d->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
06542         }
06543         lu_site_fini(&o->od_site);
06544         dt_device_fini(&o->od_dt_dev);
06545         OBD_FREE_PTR(o);
06546         RETURN(NULL);
06547 }
06548 
06549 static int osd_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
06550                               struct lu_device *d, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
06551 {
06552         struct osd_device               *o = osd_dev(d);
06553         int                             rc;
06554         ENTRY;
06555 
06556         switch (cfg->lcfg_command) {
06557         case LCFG_SETUP:
06558                 rc = osd_mount(env, o, cfg);
06559                 break;
06560         case LCFG_CLEANUP:
06561                 lu_dev_del_linkage(d->ld_site, d);
06562                 rc = osd_shutdown(env, o);
06563                 break;
06564         case LCFG_PARAM:
06565                 LASSERT(&o->od_dt_dev);
06566                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OSD, lprocfs_osd_obd_vars,
06567                                               cfg, &o->od_dt_dev);
06568                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS)
06569                         rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OST,
06570                                                       lprocfs_osd_obd_vars,
06571                                                       cfg, &o->od_dt_dev);
06572                 break;
06573         default:
06574                 rc = -ENOSYS;
06575         }
06576 
06577         RETURN(rc);
06578 }
06579 
06580 static int osd_recovery_complete(const struct lu_env *env,
06581                                  struct lu_device *d)
06582 {
06583         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dev(d);
06584         int                      rc = 0;
06585         ENTRY;
06586 
06587         if (osd->od_quota_slave == NULL)
06588                 RETURN(0);
06589 
06590         /* start qsd instance on recovery completion, this notifies the quota
06591          * slave code that we are about to process new requests now */
06592         rc = qsd_start(env, osd->od_quota_slave);
06593         RETURN(rc);
06594 }
06595 
06596 /*
06597  * we use exports to track all osd users
06598  */
06599 static int osd_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
06600                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
06601                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
06602 {
06603         struct osd_device    *osd = osd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
06604         struct lustre_handle  conn;
06605         int                   rc;
06606         ENTRY;
06607 
06608         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", osd->od_connects);
06609 
06610         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
06611         if (rc)
06612                 RETURN(rc);
06613 
06614         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
06615 
06616         spin_lock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
06617         osd->od_connects++;
06618         spin_unlock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
06619 
06620         RETURN(0);
06621 }
06622 
06623 /*
06624  * once last export (we don't count self-export) disappeared
06625  * osd can be released
06626  */
06627 static int osd_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
06628 {
06629         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
06630         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
06631         int                rc, release = 0;
06632         ENTRY;
06633 
06634         /* Only disconnect the underlying layers on the final disconnect. */
06635         spin_lock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
06636         osd->od_connects--;
06637         if (osd->od_connects == 0)
06638                 release = 1;
06639         spin_unlock(&osd->od_osfs_lock);
06640 
06641         rc = class_disconnect(exp); /* bz 9811 */
06642 
06643         if (rc == 0 && release)
06644                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
06645         RETURN(rc);
06646 }
06647 
06648 static int osd_prepare(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *pdev,
06649                        struct lu_device *dev)
06650 {
06651         struct osd_device       *osd    = osd_dev(dev);
06652         struct lr_server_data   *lsd    =
06653                         &osd->od_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_tgt->lut_lsd;
06654         int                      result = 0;
06655         ENTRY;
06656 
06657         if (osd->od_quota_slave != NULL) {
06658                 /* set up quota slave objects */
06659                 result = qsd_prepare(env, osd->od_quota_slave);
06660                 if (result != 0)
06661                         RETURN(result);
06662         }
06663 
06664         if (lsd->lsd_feature_incompat & OBD_COMPAT_OST) {
06665 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(3, 0, 52, 0)
06666                 if (lsd->lsd_feature_rocompat & OBD_ROCOMPAT_IDX_IN_IDIF) {
06667                         osd->od_index_in_idif = 1;
06668                 } else {
06669                         osd->od_index_in_idif = 0;
06670                         result = osd_register_proc_index_in_idif(osd);
06671                         if (result != 0)
06672                                 RETURN(result);
06673                 }
06674 #else
06675                 osd->od_index_in_idif = 1;
06676 #endif
06677         }
06678 
06679         result = osd_fid_init(env, osd);
06680 
06681         RETURN(result);
06682 }
06683 
06684 static int osd_fid_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
06685                          struct lu_fid *fid, struct md_op_data *op_data)
06686 {
06687         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
06688 
06689         return seq_client_alloc_fid(env, osd->od_cl_seq, fid);
06690 }

06724         .ldt_name     = LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME,

06726         .ldt_ctx_tags = LCT_LOCAL,

06728 
06729 static int osd_health_check(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
06730 {
06731         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
06732         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd);
06733 
06734         return (osd->od_mnt == NULL || sb->s_flags & MS_RDONLY);
06735 }
06736 
06737 /*
06738  * lprocfs legacy support.
06739  */
06740 static struct obd_ops osd_obd_device_ops = {
06741         .o_owner = THIS_MODULE,
06742         .o_connect      = osd_obd_connect,
06743         .o_disconnect   = osd_obd_disconnect,
06744         .o_fid_alloc    = osd_fid_alloc,
06745         .o_health_check = osd_health_check,
06746 };
06747 
06748 static int __init osd_init(void)
06749 {
06750         int rc;
06751 
06752         LASSERT(BH_DXLock < sizeof(((struct buffer_head *)0)->b_state) * 8);
06753 #if !defined(CONFIG_DEBUG_MUTEXES) && !defined(CONFIG_DEBUG_SPINLOCK)
06754         /* please, try to keep osd_thread_info smaller than a page */
06755         CLASSERT(sizeof(struct osd_thread_info) <= PAGE_SIZE);
06756 #endif
06757 
06758         osd_oi_mod_init();
06759 
06760         rc = lu_kmem_init(ldiskfs_caches);
06761         if (rc)
06762                 return rc;
06763 
06764         rc = class_register_type(&osd_obd_device_ops, NULL, true,
06765                                  lprocfs_osd_module_vars,
06766                                  LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME, &osd_device_type);
06767         if (rc)
06768                 lu_kmem_fini(ldiskfs_caches);
06769         return rc;
06770 }
06771 
06772 static void __exit osd_exit(void)
06773 {
06774         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME);
06775         lu_kmem_fini(ldiskfs_caches);
06776 }

06779 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre Object Storage Device ("LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME")");
06780 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
06781 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
06782 
06783 module_init(osd_init);
06784 module_exit(osd_exit);
